commit_message:
Do not include Admin network twice

Admin network was included into networks list twice in case of using
multiple node groups. Because of that the allocation algorithm had
an assumption that Admin network was not allocated to NIC and allocated
it twice, fisrt time - to the right NIC, second - to the first NIC always.
The issue arrived when node was in non-default node group and was booted
not from the first NIC. This issue was fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1557580
Change-Id: I64a9ecdad1e68e4f0819940f0266699c394e9caf

commit_message:
Add missing master node's logs to Diag Snapshot

MOS 8.0 Diagnostic Snapshot doesn't contain essential log files.
Examples are messages, security, cron files and anaconda, sa
directories. This issue will complicate troubleshooting and needs to
be fixed.

Change-Id: I59875f25a3d418133a12e92ad6604e6f14f5fbaa
Closes-Bug: #1544966

commit_message:
Add common testing repo to OpenStack-Ansible

In order to facilitate a common testing implementation across
all roles instead of maintaining copies of the basic scaffolding
across multiple repositories, OpenStack-Ansible is implementing
a new repository to store the common scaffolding.

Needed-By: Ib075e76a202ec931a0d0b57c81270d3b3634cad9
Change-Id: Ib9a3fc36bc5cd8ff946dbe7fea77bc0df2b92b53

commit_message:
Disable services for tempest gate

We want to run the bare minimum of OpenStack components for monasca-log-api
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I4327888124af03521de45792f34130579b1ea07f

commit_message:
Make bindep Python 3.5 unit test jobs vote

Since bindep is consistently passing unit tests under Python 3.5,
switch the job to voting and lock that in.

Change-Id: Ic66299c9910d49108bc0595c6ec16980e4595747

commit_message:
Application Development Framework

Build a library of MuranoPL classes to define basic building blocks
for the applications utilizing standard patterns for scaling, load
balancing, healing etc, allow the apps to be deployed on various
clouds (supporting both multiple regions of OpenStack and other cloud
types as well).

Change-Id: I84d4f3dfec861f282602e57f076b16d3dc4c7556
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/14/312814/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Scalable Application Framework ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/scalable-application-framework Build a library of MuranoPL classes to define basic building blocks for the applications utilizing standard patterns for scaling, load balancing, healing etc, allow the apps to be deployed on various clouds (supporting both multiple regions of OpenStack and other cloud types as well). Problem description =================== Currently Murano Applications are not opinionated about the workflow they have to follow to be scalable, highly available, (self) healable and so on. The only interface which is declared for a standard murano application defines a single method called “deploy” which has to implement the complete provisioning procedure of the app. This approach is cumbersome, requires lots of coding \while most of the code is a boilerplate which could be reused by most the applications. Also, the “deploy” workflow is just a beginning of applications’ life in the cloud: Murano app should define the lifecycle management of the app as well: to handle the scaling, healing and upgrading behaviors. Similarly to the deployment behaviors these kinds of workflow may have some generic steps which should be made on most of the applications and should not require manual copying. It would be beneficial for the developers of Murano Applications to have a set of base classes defining the standard building blocks for the typical applications and their life cycle management operations. So Murano should allow Application Developers to focus on their application-specific tasks only (e.g. “how to install the software on the VMs”, “how to configure it to interact with other apps” etc) without the real need to dive into resource orchestration, server farm configuration and so on. The application developers’ experience has to be as lightweight as possible: ideally they should be able to focus on the software configuration tools (scripts, puppets etc) and completely ignore the MuranoPL if they do not need to define any custom workflow logic. Proposed change =============== It is proposed to implement a set of base classes for the applications and their components. The existing classes of the Core Library also has to be modified to be properly consumable by the new classes – as well as to be cross-cloud ready and interoperable. Library structure ----------------- The set of the new and updated classes described in this spec is by any means not complete, as well as the structure of these classes: the intent of this work is to kickstart the changes, to to invent a complete solution with excessive class hierarchies. Base resource classes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The following hierarchy is proposed to replace the current "Instance" classes: :: +----------+ +----------------+ | | | | | Server | | MuranoAgent | | | | | +-+--+--+--+ +--+--+--+--+----+ ^ | ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ | | | | | | | +---------------+ | +-----------+ +---+ | | | | | | | | | | +-----------+---------+ +----+------+ +---+---+---+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | ContainerizedServer | | VMServer | | AgentHost | | | | | | | | | | | | | +------+--------------+ +---+---+---+ +-----------+ | | | ^ ^ ^ | | | | | | | | | | +---------+ +------------+ | | | | | | | | | | +-----+--------+ +-----------+-----+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | AwsServer | | OpenStackServer | | | | | | | | | | | | | +-----+--------+ +-----------+-----+ | | | | ^ ^ | | | | | | | | | | +---------+ +----------------------+ | | | | | | | | | +---------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | +------+------+---+ +-----+---+-------+ +-+---------------+-----+ | | | | | | | AgentContainer | | AwsMuranoServer | | OpenStackMuranoServer | | | | | | | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------------+ **Server** This is a base MuranoPL class to represent a "server" - i.e. a machine ( physical or virtual) under a control of some operating system and intended for running applications on top of it. This is the most generic, abstract class and thus it defines just the most common properties: hostname and associated abstractions of the server resources: NICs and volumes. **MuranoAgent** A class to interact with the Murano Agent: it is capable to execute software configuration commands with the use of Murano-agent component deployed on some remote host. Such commands may either be executed synchronously or asynchronously. The class encapsulates the configuration of the transport, such as the name of the message queue etc. This class may be used as a mixin to add the agent functionality to different implementations of the `Server` class. Most of the Servers managed by Murano are expected to use this mixin. **ContainerizedServer** A base class reserved for the servers which run as a container. The applications intended to be run in containerized environments are usually quite different from the applications intended to be run in VM, so the usage of this class is likely to be very different from others in the hierarchy. However, theoretically it is possible to run apps in a container as if they were on a regular VM (it would just ignore all the benefits of containerized environments). To support such cases in future it is suggested to include this class into the proposed library. **VMServer** An abstract class representing a server provisioned and orchestrated by Murano at some cloud infrastructure. This class defines an abstract ``provision`` method which should be implemented by its inheritors to provide the particular workflow to orchestrate a server-deployment process in a given cloud. **AgentHost** Some pre-existing server (either virtualized or bare metal) with the Murano agent installed on it. The lifecycle of the server itself is not managed by murano, but it may be configured using the deployed agent. The class is formed by mixing in the ``MuranoAgent`` to the ``Server``. **AwsServer** A virtual machine which murano provisions in AWS EC2. Has AWS-specific configuration properties, expects attached resources (ports, volumes, connected networks) to be of appropriate AWS-specific subclasses. **OpenStackServer** A virtual machine which murano provisions in OpenStack. Has OpenStack- specific configuration properties, expects attached resources (ports, volumes, connected networks) to be of appropriate OpenStack-specific subclasses. **AgentContainer** A subclass of ``ContainerizedServer`` mixed in with ``MuranoAgent`` thus providing capabilities to run software configuration commands in containerized server. **AwsMuranoServer** A subclass of ``AwsServer`` mixed in with ``MuranoAgent`` thus providing capabilities to run software configuration commands on AWS VM. **OpenStackMuranoServer** A subclass of ``OpenStackServer`` mixed in with ``MuranoAgent`` thus providing capabilities to run software configuration commands on OpenStack VM. Other infrastructure resources should follow the same class hierarchy: a generic one on top, a virtual one subclassing it, AWS- and OpenStack-specific ones subclassing the virtual one. These resources should include: * Volumes * Network Ports * Networks * Subnets * Routers * Router ports * Security groups and their rules Scaling primitives ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To properly handle various scaling scenarios it is required to have a set of classes which will be able to group similar resources together, produce new copies of the same resources or release the existing ones on request. The following hierarchy of classes is proposed to define this functionality on the generic level as well as to implement it for the case of the Servers/VMs: :: +-------+ | +-------+ +------------------+ +--------------------+ | | +--------+ | | | | | | | +--+ ReplicationGroup +--+ ReplicationFactory | +-+ | Object | | | | | +-+ | +---------+--------+ +--------+-----------+ +--------+ ^ ^ | | | | | | | | +-------+ | | | +-------+ +--------+------+ +----------+----+ +--------+ | | +--------+ | | | | | | | | | +---+ ServerGroup +--+ ServerFactory +---------+ Cloud | +-+ | Server | | | | | | | +-+ | +---------------+ +----+-----+----+ +-+----+-+ +--------+ ^ ^ ^ ^ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +-------------------+-+ | +---------+-+ | | | | | | | | AwsServerFactory +----------+ AwsCloud | | | | | | | | +---------------------+ | +-----------+ | | | | | +----------------------+-+ +--------------+-+ | | | | | OpenStackServerFactory +----+ OpenStackCloud | | | | | +------------------------+ +----------------+ **ReplicationGroup** A base class which does the object replication. It holds the collection of objects in one of its InputOutput properties (so the objects may be both generated in runtime and passed as the user input) and contains a reference to a ``ReplicationFactory`` object which it used to dynamically generate the objects in runtime. Input properties of this class include the ``minReplicas`` and ``maxReplicas`` allowing to limit the number of objects it holds in its collection. An input-output property ``requiredNumberOfReplicas`` allows to declaratively change the set of objects in the collection by setting its size. The ``deploy`` method of this class will be used to apply the replica settings: it will drop the collection objects if their number exceeds the specified by the ``requiredNumberOfReplicas`` or generate some new if some are missing. **ReplicationFactory** A class to generate the objects for a ``Replication Group``. The base one is abstract, its inheritors should implement the abstract ``createInstance`` method to create the actual object. The method may accept some index parameter to properly parametrize the newly created copy. The concrete implementations of this class should define all the input properties needed to create new instances of object. Thus the factory actually acts as a template of the object it generates. **ServerGroup** An implementation of the ``Replication Group`` class to replicate the ``Server``. The contract of its ``factory`` property is narrowed to accept only the subclasses of a ``ServerFactory`` class. The ``deploy`` method of this group not only generates new instances of servers but also deploys them if needed. **ServerFactory** More concrete (yet still abstract) subclass of ``ReplicationFactory`` which is used to produce the objects subclassing ``Server``. The class is needed to properly constrain the ``factory`` property of the ``ServerGroup`` class. **Cloud** A base cloud to store the configuration of the cloud of some type. It may define lots of various properties and method to interact with some specific cloud of the particular type, but most of these are out of scope for this particular spec. Regarding to this spec it is required that the subclasses of the ``ServerFactory`` class interact with the appropriate subclasses of the ``Cloud`` to generate the ``Server`` instances of the appropriate type in that given cloud. **AwsServerFactory** A template for creating the servers of the type ``AwsServer``. Uses a cloud defined by a ``AwsCloud`` type. **AwsCloud** An implementation of ``Cloud`` to interact with the Amazon EC2 services. **OpenStackServerFactory** A template for creating the servers of the type ``OpenStackServer``. Uses a cloud defined by a ``OpenStackCloud`` type. **OpenStackCloud** An implementation of ``Cloud`` to interact with the OpenStack services. Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- REST API impact --------------- Versioning impact ----------------- Other end user impact --------------------- Deployer impact --------------- Developer impact ---------------- Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ativelkov Other contributors: tbd Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ==========

commit_message:
Add OpenStack Infra internal repositories to APT source lists

Distribution: jessie-newton

pkgdeb-build-pkg Jenkins job fails [1] because of an old (22)
openstack-pkg-tools package version which is used during installation
and does not contain required pkgos-infra-install-sbuild binary.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/35/348435/1/check/pkgdeb-build-pkg/
    e55e9dc/console.html

Change-Id: Ia4811a006225031a83b8258c15c36c82bf8fe54b

commit_message:
Forbid ironic grenade job from building ramdisk

Because DEVSTACK_GATE explicitly sets
DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 unless it's set otherwise, without
setting this explicitly, grenade jobs will always have a ramdisk custom
built, which is prone to more errors vs using the prebuilt ones with no
additional benefit.

Additionally, updated two misconfigured jobs to set build-ramdisk to an
empty string, as expected, instead of 1.

Change-Id: Icc56830fe07f01631058ef9aece7cdf11c0ffc4d
Related-bug: 1607981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/91/350791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
NetApp: Report hybrid aggregates in volume stats

NetApp cDOT controllers can mix SSDs and spinning disks
in the same aggregate, where the SSDs are used for a
cache.  This commit reports the hybrid aggregate attribute
to the scheduler for each pool for use in extra specs
matching.  This commit also ensures that all aggregate
values reported to the Cinder scheduler correctly include
a vendor-specific prefix.

Implements: blueprint netapp-report-cdot-hybrid-aggrs
Change-Id: I8fbfbe3ffaad5fe89db03d2a4e567e9b35e59d5b

commit_message:
return the name of the cache file created

Have the function that creates the cache file return the name of the
file created so the caller doesn't have to know how that name is
constructed from default values.

Change-Id: I576045e1591badc84722e28072c7aed36a35be38
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Implement tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades job

Add a new experimental job in the serie of upgrade testing:
gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades-nv

This job will deploy an undercloud and a single node overcloud (nonha)
on Mitaka, and upgrade it to Newton.

Experimental and non voting for now.

Change-Id: I2ab87862a019e983c1a4b06a52e8de7bd8a5af51

commit_message:
Timing metrics for agent deploy classes

This change adds timing metrics for all agent deploy classes. The only
methods we are not emitting metrics for are those that return static
results.

Change-Id: I96290be44a60635f3bd68e7a43549e2f67a19f12
Related-bug: #1526219

commit_message:
Changing "driver_volume_type" flag of GPFS driver to "local"

As the cinder volumes are presented to VMs as local vdisks by GPFS
cinder driver and we are not using "gpfs" (TCP/IP) protocol in volume
operation.

Change-Id: I7cc278b019fb972598d7d15c18d779978ed9c235

commit_message:
Correct the installation doc

The instacllation doc should provide the senlin dashboard install
in devstack method, because horizon is a core service, many
developer will install this service. And if the developer want
to develop senlin-dashboard there is no doc instruction to guide
them how to install this horizon plugin.
Besides, there is a incorrect step in the install guide.

Change-Id: I375f04cb1e2621ce59740770566692e6643add05

Run ``./stack.sh``.
deleted_lines: git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack cd devstack 2. Add this repo as an external repository into your ``local.conf`` file:: enable_plugin senlin https://git.openstack.org/openstack/senlin 3. Run ``stack.sh``.

commit_message:
Neutron: configure requested amount of fixed_ips

The code would only configure one fixed IP irrespective
if there were more than one port configured on the instance.
This was done in commit 55af31cfec74244de4efbc7187a548972c4d99f3.

The patch does a number of things:
1. it will only allocate a fixed ip if there is no fixed ip allocated
   on the port
2. It will only do this once per port
3. If will do for all ports on the instance

It is not even clear if this feature is actually used.

Change-Id: Ib143694e76e6456bf7226047a2a70c437c7002a3
Closes-bug: #1430512

commit_message:
Document additional NODE vars

$NODE_COUNT, $NODE_DISK, and $UNDERCLOUD_NODE_DISK weren't previously
documented.

Also, document the default values in the examples shown.

Change-Id: Ifc99a88625f97221fd4cad77e3d50f112f8b8e3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/08/350708/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: By default, 2 overcloud VMs will be created with 1 vCPU, 5120 MiB RAM and 40 GB. To adjust those values set the following:: export NODE_COUNT=2 export NODE_CPU=1 export NODE_MEM=5120 export NODE_DISK=40 The undercloud VM will be created with 2 vCPU and 6144 MiB and 30 GB of disk by default. To ajust those values set the following:: export UNDERCLOUD_NODE_CPU=2 export UNDERCLOUD_NODE_MEM=6144 export UNDERCLOUD_NODE_DISK=40
deleted_lines: By default, the overcloud VMs will be created with 1 vCPU and 5120 MiB RAM and the undercloud VM with 2 vCPU and 6144 MiB. To adjust those values:: export NODE_CPU=4 export NODE_MEM=16384 Note the settings above only influence the VMs created for overcloud deployment. If you want to change the values for the undercloud node:: export UNDERCLOUD_NODE_CPU=4 export UNDERCLOUD_NODE_MEM=16384

commit_message:
Neutron: remove future warnings

Remove warnings in the neutron unit tests that contain:

    FutureWarning: fake is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields with
    invalid UUIDs is no longer supported, and will be removed in
    a future release. Please update your code to input valid UUIDs
    or accept ValueErrors for invalid UUIDs

Change-Id: I79da47465484fbbb32bab7901d6af39c84eb8d62

commit_message:
Improve docs for v3 roles

In preparation to add functional tests for v3 roles, this
change proposes to detail the method docs, because the tests
need to be based on them.

Change-Id: I67d0649f734d19e1b9547f8ebe5dced1ce8cf7f8
Partial-Bug: #1330769
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/46/334546/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Create a role. :param str name: the name of the role. :param domain: the domain of the role. :type domain: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.domains.Domain` :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the created role returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """ """Create an inference Rule that states one Role implies another Role. :param prior_role: the role which implies another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param implied_role: the role which is implied by another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the created role_inference is returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.InferenceRule` """ """Delete an inference Rule that states one Role implies another Role. :param prior_role: the role which implies another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param implied_role: the role which is implied by another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: 204 No Content. """ """Retrieve a Rule that states one Role implies another Role. :param prior_role: the role which implies another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param implied_role: the role which is implied by another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the specified role_inference is returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.InferenceRule` """ """Check and retrieve a specifice inference Rule if if it exists. :param prior_role: the role which implies another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param implied_role: the role which is implied by another role. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the specified role_inference is returned from server if it exists. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.InferenceRule` :returns: 204 No Content if specified role_inference doesn't exist. """ """List role_inferences. :param kwargs: attributes provided will be passed to the server. :returns: a list of roles_inferences. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.InferenceRule` """ """Retrieve a role. :param role: the role to be retrieved from the server. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :returns: the specified role returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """ return super(RoleManager, self).get(role_id=base.getid(role)) :param user: filter in role grants on the specified user and (domain or project) pair. :type user: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param group: filter in role grants on the specified group and (domain or project) pair. :type group: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.groups.Group` :param domain: filter in role grants on the specified (user or group) and domain pair. :type domain: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.domains.Domain` :param project: filter in role grants on the specified (user or group) and project pair. :type project: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.projects.Project` :param bool os_inherit_extension_inherited: OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will filter roles on. :returns: a list of roles. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """Update a role. :param role: the role to be updated on the server. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param str name: the new name of the role. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to server. :returns: the updated role returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """ """Delete a role. :param role: the role to be deleted on the server. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :returns: 204 No Content. """ """Grant a role to a (user or group) on a (domain or project). :param role: the role to be granted on the server. :type role: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` :param user: grant role to the specified user and (domain or project) pair. :type user: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param group: grant role to the specified group and (domain or project) pair. :type group: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.groups.Group` :param domain: grant role to the specified (user or group) and domain pair. :type domain: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.domains.Domain` :param project: grant role to the specified (user or group) and project pair. :type project: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.projects.Project` :param bool os_inherit_extension_inherited: OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to server. :returns: the granted role returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """Check if a (user or group) has a role on a (domain or project). :param user: check for role grants on the specified user and (domain or project) pair. :type user: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param group: check for role grants on the specified group and (domain or project) pair. :type group: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.groups.Group` :param domain: check for role grants on the specified (user or group) and domain pair. :type domain: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.domains.Domain` :param project: check for role grants on the specified (user or group) and project pair. :type project: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.projects.Project` :param bool os_inherit_extension_inherited: OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to server. :returns: the checked role returned from server. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role` """Revoke a role from a (user or group) on a (domain or project). :param user: revoke role grants on the specified user and (domain or project) pair. :type user: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param group: revoke role grants on the specified group and (domain or project) pair. :type group: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.groups.Group` :param domain: revoke role grants on the specified (user or group) and domain pair. :type domain: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.domains.Domain` :param project: revoke role grants on the specified (user or group) and project pair. :type project: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.projects.Project` :param bool os_inherit_extension_inherited: OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to server. :returns: the revoked role returned from server. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.roles.Role`
deleted_lines: return super(RoleManager, self).get( role_id=base.getid(role)) If no arguments are provided, all roles in the system will be listed. If a user or group is specified, you must also specify either a domain or project to list role grants on that pair. And if ``**kwargs`` are provided, then also filter roles with attributes matching ``**kwargs``. If 'os_inherit_extension_inherited' is passed, then OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. """Grant a role to a user or group on a domain or project. If 'os_inherit_extension_inherited' is passed, then OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. """Check if a user or group has a role on a domain or project. If 'os_inherit_extension_inherited' is passed, then OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy. """Revoke a role from a user or group on a domain or project. If 'os_inherit_extension_inherited' is passed, then OS-INHERIT will be used. It provides the ability for projects to inherit role assignments from their domains or from projects in the hierarchy.

commit_message:
[config-ref] Move octavia pagination parameter

1. Move "pagination_max_limit" to the common configuration
options table
2. Remove include directive to a non-existent file

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/#/c/350363/

backport: mitaka
Closes-bug: #1605039
Change-Id: I77446b127df5d99347f04af18499b92a56d56792

commit_message:
Optionally remove portage files

Optionally remove portage files, so that we can cache package and
keep the portage directory around, specifically for nodepool.

This also adds a section to the Gentoo readme about the variable
and renames the 00-gentoo-distro-name environment file to a more
appropriate name of 00-gentoo-envars.

Also brought up was the location of the gentoo-releng.gpg file,
this has been moved and the refrencing paths updated.

Change-Id: I20c91b36082828faa1ca481585acc5f9933211e1

subject: Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 02:28:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f9c3bc05d26b1ab6796bf72dabb3299e492bb493', 'message': 'Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"

This reverts commit f87b58fcabf84c9b73b07b587416cc0b6cc814b1.
In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming.
After this change, strings with multi lines cannot be translated.

This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
Message extraction is done by babel (with horizon specific extractor),

commit_message:
Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"

This reverts commit f87b58fcabf84c9b73b07b587416cc0b6cc814b1.
In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming.
After this change, strings with multi lines cannot be translated.

This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
Message extraction is done by babel (with horizon specific extractor),
but translation message lookup is done by angular-gettext.
As a result, a key used in translation lookup becomes different from
a key generated by the message extraction.
Keys in both steps should be same.
So this patch reverts the corresponding commit to make translation
work, even though it may be annoying for translators again.

Regarding the comment from i18n perspective, see Akihiro's comment
in patch set 3 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347725

Closes-Bug: #1606837
Change-Id: I651a2f39fdc0209f702cb9cf45691c944382b897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/58/349758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.data.strip(), self.plural_form messages = self.data.strip()
deleted_lines: from django.utils.translation import trim_whitespace trim_whitespace(self.data.strip()), trim_whitespace(self.plural_form) messages = trim_whitespace(self.data.strip())

subject: Make shell main() specify return value in exit code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-30 14:31:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient/commit/eef883042cb151e06edc9f8f1709eeeb541f81fb', 'message': 'Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())


e.g. :

If we write aaa.py like this:

import sys

def main():
    sys.exit(100)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Then,

[root@tangchen stack]# python
>>> import aaa
>>> aaa.main()
[root@tangchen stack]# echo $?
100


If we write it like this:

import sys

def main():
    return 100

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

Then it becomes:

[root@tangchen stack]# python
>>> import aaa
>>> aaa
<module 'aaa' from 'aaa.py'>
>>> aaa.main()
100
>>>


This patch does the same to the shell main().

Change-Id: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-30 15:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient/commit/b2c4c7ec9598c81881e70cbf5ac2e7f3f00eb046', 'message': 'Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c
'}]
commit_message:
Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/96/349196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return 130 return 1 sys.exit(main())

commit_message:
Add debug logging for RevokeEvent deserialize problem

There was no log message showing what the cached value was when
the server fails to recreate a cached RevokeEvent, making it
difficult to debug the problem.

Change-Id: If142f2abd3cc497b11fb7529935d14af037c69f0
Partial-Bug: 1609566

commit_message:
Do not allow spaces as key pair name

This fixes a bug where spaces were treated as a valid key pair
name.

Change-Id: Ie0dc31111db3753b8fb9f31159da9fb43d5a74aa
Closes-Bug: #1509217

commit_message:
[Django 1.10] Fix URL patterns again

The URL patterns was deprecated in ~1.7, and this style has been
removed from the Horizon codebase multiple times. Cleaning up again.

commit_message:
Optional setting service client on factory

Add the ability to store a copy of an initialised service client
on the service client factory, accessible via an attribute named
as a specified alias.

This allows to stop initialising all clients at __init__ time,
while preserving the ability to initialise them only once, for
instance in the setup_clients phase of tests.

Change-Id: I8b2a907f68214dd1fce1d057408d3ddd1e4bdc0a
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/26/336126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_partial_class(self, klass, auth_provider, kwargs): def partial_class(alias=None, **later_kwargs): """Returns a callable the initialises a service client Builds a callable that accepts kwargs, which are passed through to the __init__ of the service client, along with a set of defaults set in factory at factory __init__ time. Original args in the service client can only be passed as kwargs. It accepts one extra parameter 'alias' compared to the original service client. When alias is provided, the returned callable will also set an attribute called with a name defined in 'alias', which contains the instance of the service client. :param alias: str Name of the attribute set on the factory once the callable is invoked which contains the initialised service client. If None, no attribute is set. :param later_kwargs: kwargs passed through to the service client __init__ on top of defaults set at factory level. """ _client = klass(auth_provider=auth_provider, **kwargs) if alias: setattr(self, alias, _client) return _client
deleted_lines: @classmethod def _get_partial_class(cls, klass, auth_provider, kwargs): def partial_class(**later_kwargs): return klass(auth_provider=auth_provider, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Retry revocation on MySQL deadlock

Added wrapper for revoke method that makes additional attempts on
deadlock.

Change-Id: I506c6b432d4d23619237a32414d0039c749cd8b6
Closes-Bug: #1604862

added_lines: import mockfrom oslo_db import exception as oslo_db_exception @mock.patch('sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.delete', autospec=True, side_effect=oslo_db_exception.DBDeadlock) def test_reties_on_deadlock(self, mock_delete): user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex self.assertRaises(oslo_db_exception.DBDeadlock, self.revoke_api.revoke, revoke_model.RevokeEvent(user_id=user_id)) # initial attempt + 5 retries revoke_attempt_count = 6 self.assertEqual(mock_delete.call_count, revoke_attempt_count)

commit_message:
Fix stale docstring in SegmentedIterable.

At some point, we added stuff to listing_iter, but didn't update the
docstring. I noticed this while trying to write code using a
SegmentedIterable when it wouldn't take my 3-tuples like the docstring
claimed it would.

Change-Id: I8f6667e97b1277f5b403a5f6fa7f9d708bb19249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/29/350829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: along with the byte subranges to fetch, in the form of a 5-tuple (object-path, object-etag, object-size, first-byte, last-byte). If object-etag is None, no MD5 verification will be done. If object-size is None, no length verification will be done. If first-byte and last-byte are None, then the entire object will be fetched.
deleted_lines: along with the byte subranges to fetch, in the form of a tuple (object-path, first-byte, last-byte) or (object-path, None, None) to fetch the whole thing.

commit_message:
Towards non-locking model: Add 'unique_key' for delayed calls

* In our upcoming engine changes we need the ability to schedule
  delayed calls so that we could restrict a number of certain
  calls by providing a unique key which in combination with
  'processing' flag composes a database unique constraint
* Added DB API methods for getting and deleting all delayed calls
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I35eba1395bef405e24aff01ad898f9e19f557b99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/45/349445/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sa.UniqueConstraint('unique_key', 'processing') unique_key = sa.Column(sa.String(50), nullable=True)

commit_message:
Add Keystone project validation for image sharing

Change-Id: Ic7d4ddc0d9302e56fe8b1ef9e6bc95d1a9b8ca75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/00/321200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Verify Keystone project ID for image sharing ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/validate-keystone-project When a tenant user want to share an image to another tenant, firstly, he needs to get the correct project/tenant id the image will be shared to. Generally, user get the project/tenant id by copy-paste from an email, messager or somewhere. And unfortunately, Glance won't check if it's exist in Keystone. The scope of this blueprint is to add project id validation to image sharing function. Use Cases ---------- As an user, when I attempt to share an image to another tenant, and I accidentally provide an invalid project id: * I want to know the project id I provided is invalid. Problem description =================== Glance image sharing through the CLI require user provides the project id which the image will be shared to. Nothing actually checks if this project id actually exists, so user can easily specify an invalid project. Recently Nova just approved a similar spec to validate project id for quota management[1], so that means the work in this spec can be leverage after Glance migrate to per-tenant quota design. If an invalid project id is set to the image, then the target tenant will never get the image be shared. Proposed change =============== Glance can use the Glance admin token to query Keystone. The Keystone response will determine access to the project and indicate if the project exists. If the requestor can pass the authentication check: * Return HTTP 200 response from Keystone if the project exists. * Return HTTP 404 response from Keystone if the project doesn't exist. And Glance will return HTTP 400 to end user. The change will be only added to V2. Alternatives ------------ Just leave it as it is, create member without any check. Data model impact ----------------- N/A REST API impact --------------- N/A Security impact --------------- N/A Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- N/A Performance Impact ------------------ The performance impact for member creating should be very very small, because it's not a very frequent action. Other deployer impact --------------------- N/A Developer impact ---------------- N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Fei Long Wang <flwang> Reviewers --------- Core reviewer(s): <nikhil> <rosmaita> Other reviewer(s): <wxy> Work Items ---------- * Add a common method to check if a project is existing in Keystone * Throw HTTP 400 error when the project is invalid Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= * Unit test will be added to make sure a HTTP 400 error will be thrown when the project is not existing. Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. References ========== [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294337/

commit_message:
Fix for creation of network environment twice

The patch solves the problem of creation of network, router, subnet
in tempest and neutron (twice).
As we want to create the network environment in the neutron test only,
the get_client_manager should be called by BaseNetworkTest object,
when cls.network_resources dict is already populated and then
the tempest will not create a new env (if it is empty it creates a new
network setup)

Closes-Bug: #1607903
Change-Id: I73fea24af201be1bd8d6cac204234f490f5113ba

added_lines: storlets (0.1.0, Openstack Mitaka) * First storlets release since it was open sourced. * Most of the code has been refactored to ease maintainability this includes: breaking the middleware to base, proxy and object handlers restructure the gateway code to allow easier addition of new gateways simplification of the swift-docker communicartion code * Unit tests has been added to most of the python code * The documentation has been re-written and updated with focus on installation * functional tests have been enriched * Added the ability to invoke a storlet on copy including support for swift COPY middleware * Added the ability to process single range requests on object nodes to allow better performance when working with Spark. * This release is tested with Swift 2.7.0, and Openstack Keystone Mitaka

commit_message:
Create a base class for tempest tests

The tempest tests (gate-functional-dsvm-magnum-api) requires
importing modules that other tests don't require. Right now, we
import tempest modules in the common base class, which is
undesirable. This commit splitted tempest codes out so that other
tests don't need to import tempest modules.

Change-Id: I4871acdc27d66e098e2321809d7d31d4e8416abf
Related-Bug: #1596778
Closes-Bug: #1553035

added_lines: def get_copy_logs(cls): return config.Config.copy_logs @classmethod def copy_logs_handler(cls, get_nodes_fn, coe, keypair): """Copy logs closure. This method will retrieve all running nodes for a specified bay and copy addresses from there locally. :param get_nodes_fn: function that takes no parameters and returns a list of node IPs which are in such form: [[master_nodes], [slave_nodes]]. :param coe: the COE type of the nodes """ if not cls.get_copy_logs(): return lambda exec_info: None def int_copy_logs(exec_info): try: cls.LOG.info("Copying logs...") fn = exec_info[2].tb_frame.f_locals['fn'] func_name = fn.im_self._get_test_method().__name__ msg = "Failed to copy logs for bay" nodes_addresses = get_nodes_fn() master_nodes = nodes_addresses[0] slave_nodes = nodes_addresses[1] base_path = os.path.split(os.path.dirname( os.path.abspath(magnum.__file__)))[0] full_location = os.path.join(base_path, COPY_LOG_HELPER) def do_copy_logs(prefix, nodes_address): cls.LOG.info("copy logs from : %s" % ','.join(nodes_address)) log_name = prefix + "-" + func_name for node_address in nodes_address: try: cls.LOG.debug("running %s" % full_location) cls.LOG.debug("keypair: %s" % keypair) subprocess.check_call([ full_location, node_address, coe, log_name, str(keypair) ]) except Exception: cls.LOG.error(msg) cls.LOG.exception( "failed to copy from %s to %s%s-%s" % (node_address, "/opt/stack/logs/bay-nodes/", log_name, node_address)) do_copy_logs('master', master_nodes) do_copy_logs('node', slave_nodes) except Exception: cls.LOG.exception(msg) return int_copy_logs class BaseTempestTest(BaseMagnumTest): """Sets up configuration required for functional tests""" ic_class_list = [] ic_method_list = [] LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(BaseTempestTest, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) @classmethod

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I1020c9f8f7d29b03b0fd460cbc22a0238725ea8e

commit_message:
Implement Nova restoration

Using heat template to restore server_backup

Change-Id: Ic996b94756c37ab02f71300966da69a884a00688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/58/319158/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from uuid import uuid4from smaug.services.protection.restore_heat import HeatResource resource_node = kwargs.get("node") original_server_id = resource_node.value.id heat_template = kwargs.get("heat_template") name = kwargs.get("restore_name", "smaug-restore-server") LOG.info(_("restoring server backup, server_id: %s."), original_server_id) glance_client = self._glance_client(cntxt) heat_resource_id = str(uuid4()) heat_server_resource = HeatResource(heat_resource_id, constants.SERVER_RESOURCE_TYPE) bank_section = checkpoint.get_resource_bank_section(original_server_id) try: resource_definition = bank_section.get_object("metadata") snapshot_metadata = resource_definition["snapshot_metadata"] objects = [key.split("/")[-1] for key in bank_section.list_objects()] # get kernel_data if need kernel_id = None if snapshot_metadata.get("kernel_metadata") is not None: kernel_metadata = snapshot_metadata["kernel_metadata"] if kernel_metadata.get("kernel_name") is None: kernel_name = "kernel_%s@%s" % (checkpoint.id, original_server_id) else: kernel_name = kernel_metadata["kernel_name"] disk_format = kernel_metadata["disk_format"] container_format = kernel_metadata["container_format"] kernel_data = BytesIO() for obj in objects: if obj.find("kernel_") == 0: data = bank_section.get_object(obj) kernel_data.write(data) kernel_data.seek(0, os.SEEK_SET) kernel = glance_client.images.create( disk_format=disk_format, container_format=container_format, name=kernel_name) kernel_id = kernel.id glance_client.images.upload(kernel_id, kernel_data) # get ramdisk_data if need ramdisk_id = None if snapshot_metadata.get("ramdisk_metadata") is not None: ramdisk_metadata = snapshot_metadata["ramdisk_metadata"] if ramdisk_metadata.get("disk_name") is None: radisk_name = "radisk_%s@%s" % (checkpoint.id, original_server_id) else: radisk_name = ramdisk_metadata["disk_name"] disk_format = ramdisk_metadata["disk_format"] container_format = ramdisk_metadata["container_format"] ramdisk_data = BytesIO() for obj in objects: if obj.find("ramdisk_") == 0: data = bank_section.get_object(obj) ramdisk_data.write(data) ramdisk_data.seek(0, os.SEEK_SET) ramdisk = glance_client.images.create( disk_format=disk_format, container_format=container_format, name=radisk_name) ramdisk_id = ramdisk.id glance_client.images.upload(ramdisk_id, ramdisk_data) # get image_data image_data = BytesIO() for obj in objects: if obj.find("data_") == 0: data = bank_section.get_object(obj) image_data.write(data) image_data.seek(0, os.SEEK_SET) if snapshot_metadata.get("image_name") is None: image_name = "snapshot_%s@%s" % (checkpoint.id, original_server_id) else: image_name = snapshot_metadata["image_name"] disk_format = snapshot_metadata["disk_format"] container_format = snapshot_metadata["container_format"] image = glance_client.images.create( disk_format=disk_format, container_format=container_format, kernel_id=kernel_id, ramdisk_id=ramdisk_id, name=image_name) glance_client.images.upload(image.id, image_data) image_info = glance_client.images.get(image.id) retry_attempts = 10 while image_info.status != "active" and retry_attempts != 0: sleep(60) image_info = glance_client.images.get(image.id) retry_attempts -= 1 if retry_attempts == 0: raise Exception server_metadata = resource_definition["server_metadata"] attach_metadata = resource_definition["attach_metadata"] properties = { "availability_zone": server_metadata["availability_zone"], "flavor": server_metadata["flavor"], "image": image.id, "name": name, } if server_metadata["key_name"] is not None: properties["key_name"] = server_metadata["key_name"] security_groups = [] for security_group in server_metadata["security_groups"]: security_groups.append(security_group["name"]) properties["security_groups"] = security_groups networks = [] for network, network_info in server_metadata["addresses"].items(): networks.append({"network": network}) properties["networks"] = networks for key, value in properties.items(): heat_server_resource.set_property(key, value) heat_template.put_resource(original_server_id, heat_server_resource) # volume attachment for original_volume_id, device in attach_metadata.items(): heat_resource_id = str(uuid4()) heat_attachment_resource = HeatResource( heat_resource_id, constants.VOLUME_ATTACHMENT_RESOURCE) instance_uuid = heat_template.get_resource_reference( original_server_id) volume_id = heat_template.get_resource_reference( original_volume_id) properties = {"mountpoint": device, "instance_uuid": instance_uuid, "volume_id": volume_id} for key, value in properties.items(): heat_attachment_resource.set_property(key, value) heat_template.put_resource( "%s_%s" % (original_server_id, original_volume_id), heat_attachment_resource) # floating ip association for network, network_infos in server_metadata["addresses"].items(): for network_info in network_infos: if network_info["OS-EXT-IPS:type"] == "floating": heat_resource_id = str(uuid4()) heat_floating_resource = HeatResource( heat_resource_id, constants.FLOATING_IP_ASSOCIATION, ) instance_uuid = heat_template.get_resource_reference( original_server_id) floating_ip = network_info["addr"] properties = {"instance_uuid": instance_uuid, "floating_ip": floating_ip} for key, value in properties.items(): heat_floating_resource.set_property(key, value) heat_template.put_resource( "%s_%s" % (original_server_id, floating_ip), heat_floating_resource) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE("restore server backup failed, server_id: %s."), original_server_id) raise exception.RestoreBackupFailed( reason=e, resource_id=original_server_id, resource_type=constants.SERVER_RESOURCE_TYPE )
deleted_lines: # TODO(luobin): use heat template to execute restore pass

commit_message:
Update setup.cfg for memory bandwidth monitor

This patch builds on top of a series of patches that introduce
the memory bandwidth filter in nova.

This patch introduces the entry point for the memory bandwidth
monitor in the setup.cfg file.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: Ia3238bc8f626528b28dd0d00242dcf7d8697b337
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/329785/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova.compute.monitors.numa_mem_bw = virt_driver = nova.compute.monitors.numa_mem_bw.virt_driver:Monitor

commit_message:
Base enablement for memory bandwidth monitor

This patch introduces two new methods in the driver base class
that will be used for determining the memory bandwidth of a given
host node.

In addition to this, this patch also implements the methods for the
libvirt driver.

Change-Id: I71e1a44d248fc54b851925589e5cd1cfd68a07e7
Partially-Implements: blueprint memory-bw
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/266773/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_max_memory_bw(self, metric_obj): """Get the maximum value for memory bw on a host. This method is expected to be called only once during the lifecycle of the compute process. :param metric_obj: A mutable reference of the metric object """ raise NotImplementedError() def get_current_memory_count(self, metric_obj): """Get the aggregated counter values representing the memory bandwidth on the system. Counter values are taken in this case as opposed to the rate because instantenous values of the rate won't represent the bandwidth accurately. So the flexibility is that Nova will read the memory counter values and then should be able to represent a rate by keeping control of the elapsed time between two fetch operations. :param metric_obj: A mutable reference of the metric object """ raise NotImplementedError()

subject: Introduce the memory bandwidth monitor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 07:10:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a077e5d9ef2bf0f839f52f8d37e4b1717b282261', 'message': "Introduce the memory bandwidth monitor

This patch defines the numa memory bandwidth monitor.
The monitor inherits itself from the existing monitor base class.

The monitor calculates the memory bandwidth by reading the PMU
counter values via PcP. The rate is determined by calculating
the difference between two consecutive reads of the driver API
divided by the time difference. This allows nova to have a control
over the time period to represent the bandwidth instead of storing
instantenous values.

The maximum memory bandwidth is reported in the rate format and hence
the above time difference calculation doesn't apply. The maximum
memory bandwidth is not expected to change unless new memory units
are plugged into the host.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I1959eba1966765d71e4e6ef1475026689f8c00dc

commit_message:
Introduce the memory bandwidth monitor

This patch defines the numa memory bandwidth monitor.
The monitor inherits itself from the existing monitor base class.

The monitor calculates the memory bandwidth by reading the PMU
counter values via PcP. The rate is determined by calculating
the difference between two consecutive reads of the driver API
divided by the time difference. This allows nova to have a control
over the time period to represent the bandwidth instead of storing
instantenous values.

The maximum memory bandwidth is reported in the rate format and hence
the above time difference calculation doesn't apply. The maximum
memory bandwidth is not expected to change unless new memory units
are plugged into the host.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I1959eba1966765d71e4e6ef1475026689f8c00dc

commit_message:
Install pcp on n-cpu nodes

As a part of the memory bandwidth monitor, nova would attempt to
install pcp and it's associated python-bindings.

This commit tries to install pcp. Even though it's only going to
be used if the memory bandwidth monitor is enabled.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I78b284e301294b4838f31136ebec7ca7bd546aca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/334617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Introduce utility module for pcp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-17 16:57:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/87a905394011ff60922378f36a983fcfba337e09', 'message': 'Introduce utility module for pcp

This patchset introduces the pcp utility module.

This module consists of a PCPDriver that connects to the pcp
daemon and is used to fetch metric values from pcp in general.

There shall be a dependent patchset, which would use this
utility module to obtain values related to the memory bandwidth
for the memory bandwidth monitor.

TODO: Unit tests are needed.

Change-Id: I884ff2e15ec4fbb1e984abd3532a57fba2aa4f0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint memory-bw

commit_message:
Introduce utility module for pcp

This patchset introduces the pcp utility module.

This module consists of a PCPDriver that connects to the pcp
daemon and is used to fetch metric values from pcp in general.

There shall be a dependent patchset, which would use this
utility module to obtain values related to the memory bandwidth
for the memory bandwidth monitor.

Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Dasgupta <a10gupta@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I884ff2e15ec4fbb1e984abd3532a57fba2aa4f0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint memory-bw

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import exception from nova.i18n import _ from nova.i18n import _LE from nova.i18n import _LW pmapi = None c_api = None class PCPDriver(object): _instance = None def __init__(self): global pmapi global c_api if pmapi is None: try: pmapi = importutils.import_module('pcp.pmapi') except ImportError as e: msg = (_('Cannot load pmapi: (%s)') % e) raise exception.NovaException(msg) if c_api is None: try: c_api = importutils.import_module('cpmapi') except ImportError as e: msg = (_('Cannot load cpmapi: (%s)') % e) raise exception.NovaException(msg) self._connect_to_pcp_daemon() def _connect_to_pcp_daemon(self): """ Get a connection to PCP """ # TODO (sbiswas7): We are assuming that there's a pcpd running # on the system. This needs to be better handled. try: self.context = pmapi.pmContext(c_api.PM_CONTEXT_HOST, "local:") except pmapi.pmErr as ex: msg = (_("There was an error initializing PCP: %(exc)s") % {'exc': ex}) raise exception.NovaException(msg) @classmethod def get_instance(cls): """To implement singleton""" if cls._instance is None: cls._instance = PCPDriver() return cls._instance def get_metric_value(self, metric_name): """ A utility method that obtains a metric value based upon the metric name """ # NOTE (sbiswas7): We can change it to a list later and obtain them # all at once. try: metric_id = self.context.pmLookupName(metric_name) descs = self.context.pmLookupDescs(metric_id) results = self.context.pmFetch(metric_id) except pmapi.pmErr as ex: if ex.args[0] == c_api.PM_ERR_NAME: LOG.exception(_("The metric %(metric)s is not available") % {'metric': metric_name}) else: LOG.exception(_("Something bad happened, Returning")) return # This tuple define the types of the value fields. The indexing # is strict and hence the order should be maintained. value_fields = ("l", "ul", "ll", "ull", "f", "d") values_to_return = {} # again the assumption is that there would be one descriptor # returned. We'd none the less have a check. if len(descs) > 0: try: for j in xrange(results.contents.get_numval(0)): inst_id = results.contents.get_inst(0, j) value_format = results.contents.get_valfmt(0) vlist = results.contents.get_vlist(0, j) content_type = descs[0].contents.type type = descs[0].type atom = self.context.pmExtractValue(value_format, vlist, content_type, type) values_to_return[inst_id] = getattr(atom, value_fields[type]) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_("There was an error in retrieving" "the metric %(metric)s due to %(exc)s") % {'metric': metric_name, 'exc': e}) return return values_to_return

subject: tempest: stop creating network resources for each test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:17:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/62b1a7bd697ba831e6101232f11b0a18c2fb8fb6', 'message': 'tempest: stop creating network resources for each test

The way get_client_manager was overridden in neutron, it never used
network_resources set by set_network_resources() on a test class,
because the parent get_client_manager implementation was triggered on
the base class instead of on super() result, which made the class passed
into the parent method implementation different from the test class
under setup.

This small change disables network resource creation for all in tree
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I7493adbc9e3a037ef99dc75c42bc420ccc1fd7d3
Closes-Bug: #1607903
'}]
commit_message:
tempest: stop creating network resources for each test

The way get_client_manager was overridden in neutron, it never used
network_resources set by set_network_resources() on a test class,
because the parent get_client_manager implementation was triggered on
the base class instead of on super() result, which made the class passed
into the parent method implementation different from the test class
under setup.

This small change disables network resource creation for all in tree
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I7493adbc9e3a037ef99dc75c42bc420ccc1fd7d3
Closes-Bug: #1607903

commit_message:
Create segment_host mapping after new segment

As a follow up of [1], this patch will create related
SegmentHostMapping after new segment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329309/

Change-Id: Ib86fb4b6423796441983d6cfb4d7b2f9b16f21ff
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/55/337955/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six registry.subscribe(self._add_segment_host_mapping_for_segment, resources.SEGMENT, events.PRECOMMIT_CREATE) def _add_segment_host_mapping_for_segment(self, resource, event, trigger, context, segment): phynet = segment.physical_network if not phynet: return host_phynets_map = self._sb_ovn.get_chassis_hostname_and_physnets() hosts = {host for host, phynets in six.iteritems(host_phynets_map) if phynet in phynets} segment_service_db.map_segment_to_hosts(context, segment.id, hosts)

commit_message:
The sidebar caret should spin correctly.

The sidebar caret is spinning backwards 270 degrees
instead of forward 90 degrees.

Change-Id: I2523ae0ce412d6e0350ea6a31fa4d746bb206f65

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the database are renamed
to ``project_id``. Both options are equally valid, but ``project_id``
is preferred.
To inform external users about the change, HasTenant class was
deprecated.

UpgradeImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

Change-Id: I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

commit_message:
Bump up oslo.config that works with glance-store releases

With the oslo.config release 3.14.0 the bug 1605648 that affected
glance_store releases of 0.14.0 and 0.15.0 will no longer fail the
glance docs gates. So, with the bump glance can use the prior releases
of store.

Change-Id: Ic5c50ed4217dcd9b8d93916421f5334100a0b4e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/50/350250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This adds agent config options for metrics as described in the
spec, and allows those config options to be sent to IPA on
lookup. We're configuring heartbeat timeout this way, and this
change matches nicely with that style.

namespace for consistency, however, we'll allow the old way to
be deprecated when the vendor_passthru for agent lookups is
deprecated.

commit_message:
Pass agent metrics config via conductor

This adds agent config options for metrics as described in the
spec, and allows those config options to be sent to IPA on
lookup. We're configuring heartbeat timeout this way, and this
change matches nicely with that style.

Additionally, this sets heartbeat_timeout under the new config
namespace for consistency, however, we'll allow the old way to
be deprecated when the vendor_passthru for agent lookups is
deprecated.

Change-Id: I94d81b95feabe46999dbbc02522508cd542a89f8
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Partial-bug: #1526219
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/19/301919/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'node': node.as_dict(), 'config': { 'metrics': { 'backend': CONF.metrics.agent_backend, 'prepend_host': CONF.metrics.agent_prepend_host, 'prepend_uuid': CONF.metrics.agent_prepend_uuid, 'prepend_host_reverse': CONF.metrics.prepend_host_reverse, 'global_prefix': CONF.metrics.agent_global_prefix, 'statsd_host': CONF.metrics.agent_statsd_host, 'statsd_port': CONF.metrics.agent_statsd_port }, 'heartbeat_timeout': CONF.agent.heartbeat_timeout }

commit_message:
tempest: only deploy neutron fwaas and lbaas

Be more granular on what package we deploy for Tempest tests.
Our current CI only test LBaaS and FWaaS, not VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Ic53b462a3bcb9a1329ee8017f72e33f1201c64f1
Depends-On: Ied0881f93a020ba1954334e0c7549c216e6b76b1

revisions:

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we

Change-Id: I9502b0b42ed742d64517be5463e3c5f65eba61c1
Closes-bug: #1604734

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I9502b0b42ed742d64517be5463e3c5f65eba61c1
Closes-bug: #1604734
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/81/350681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py{34,35,27},py{34,35,27}-{postgresql,mysql}{,-file,-swift,-ceph},pep8,bashate py{34,35,27}-postgresql: .[postgresql,swift,ceph,file] py{34,35,27}-mysql: .[mysql,swift,ceph,file] py{34,35,27}-{postgresql,mysql}-file: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=file py{34,35,27}-{postgresql,mysql}-swift: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=swift py{34,35,27}-{postgresql,mysql}-ceph: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=ceph py{34,35,27}-postgresql{,-file,-swift,-ceph}: GNOCCHI_TEST_INDEXER_DRIVERS=postgresql py{34,35,27}-mysql{,-file,-swift,-ceph}: GNOCCHI_TEST_INDEXER_DRIVERS=mysql
deleted_lines: envlist = py{27,34,35},py{27,34,35}-{postgresql,mysql}{,-file,-swift,-ceph},pep8,bashate py{27,34,35}-postgresql: .[postgresql,swift,ceph,file] py{27,34,35}-mysql: .[mysql,swift,ceph,file] py{27,34,35}-{postgresql,mysql}-file: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=file py{27,34,35}-{postgresql,mysql}-swift: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=swift py{27,34,35}-{postgresql,mysql}-ceph: GNOCCHI_TEST_STORAGE_DRIVERS=ceph py{27,34,35}-postgresql{,-file,-swift,-ceph}: GNOCCHI_TEST_INDEXER_DRIVERS=postgresql py{27,34,35}-mysql{,-file,-swift,-ceph}: GNOCCHI_TEST_INDEXER_DRIVERS=mysql

commit_message:
Fix for "db type could not be determined" error message

If tests are run under py27 then run under py34 or py35, user may get
`db type could not be determined` error.

This patch adds a note to the dev-quickstart guide telling user to
remove the file `.testrepository/times.dbm` and then run the py34 or
py35 test to work around this error.

Change-Id: I57b583eaa8586d14cee730eefc515ad064ac8b32
Closes-Bug: #1229445 (regarding Ironic)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/02/350302/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: If tests are run under py27 then run under py34 or py35 this error may occur:: db type could not be determined ERROR: InvocationError: '/home/ubuntu/ironic/.tox/py35/bin/ostestr' Remove the file `.testrepository/times.dbm` and then run the py34 or py35 test

commit_message:
Update xiv_ds8k driver name and description

The xiv_ds8k driver now supports IBM XIV, Spectrum Accelerate,
FlashSystem A9000, FlashSystem A9000R and DS8000 storage systems.
Therefore it should be renamed to IBM Storage driver.

The actual change includes:
- text changes in comments and documentation
- changes in fields in cinder.conf
- change in variable names
- change in file names

Implements: blueprint rename-xiv-ds8k-driver
Change-Id: Ia53a60e865ddac21029ca8518b6a506cb1682c51
DocImpact

added_lines: IBM Storage driver is a unified Volume driver for IBM XIV, Spectrum Accelerate, FlashSystem A9000, FlashSystem A9000R and DS8000 storage systems. """IBM Storage driver IBM Storage driver is a unified Volume driver for IBM XIV, Spectrum Accelerate, FlashSystem A9000, FlashSystem A9000R and DS8000 storage systems. """ """Setup and verify connection to IBM Storage.""" """Create a volume on the IBM Storage system.""" """Delete a volume on the IBM Storage system.""" In the case of XIV family and FlashSystem A9000 family, the existing_ref consists of a single field named 'existing_ref' representing the name of the volume on the storage.
deleted_lines: Unified Volume driver for IBM XIV and DS8K Storage Systems. """Unified IBM XIV and DS8K volume driver.""" """Setup and verify IBM XIV and DS8K Storage connection.""" """Create a volume on the IBM XIV and DS8K Storage system.""" """Delete a volume on the IBM XIV and DS8K Storage system.""" In the case of XIV, the existing_ref consists of a single field named 'existing_ref' representing the name of the volume on the storage.

commit_message:
neutron: add granularity for aas services

Allow to whether or not install aaS services (Firewall, VPN and LB) for
Neutron Service.

The logic will still require neutron_available to be True.
If Neutron is enable, Firewall and LB will be enable by default to
successfuly run Tempest.

Depends-On: Iecddedc1ca6225e407cad04bdd5558e66f8d9e4d
Change-Id: Ied0881f93a020ba1954334e0c7549c216e6b76b1

commit_message:
Fixes Octavia handling of subnets without DHCP

Currently Octavia assumes that DHCP service is available on
the VIP and member subnets.  This is not the case at all operators.
This patch makes Octavia use the IP information provided when
the ports are created, if available.  If the IP information is
not available on the ports it will fall back to relying on DHCP.

Change-Id: I08a93d4318bbce48128019376320782d1a334369
Closes-Bug: #1607900

commit_message:
Fixes nova host configuration on control nodes

Closes-Bug: 1604907

nova.conf and neutron.conf is not being configured with host,
resulting in lack of fqdn in host for nova services on the control
nodes.  Upon reboot duplicate instances of nova services are found
with correct fqdn on their hostname.  This fixes nova and neutron
conf to set the host value in controller manifests, similar to how
it is done in compute manifest.

This is a backport of Ieb793b9e9fd2dfc98584691412f9991aa99e0b47

Change-Id: Ie11b39de35194c020a8a09b57fdb11e882c5ec7b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Sync neutron callbacks into lib

Update neutron-lib callbacks with the latest from neutron
in preparation for updates to the callback notification interface.
The callback updates also require a few module level functions
in the db package.

A few additional unit tests are also added for coverage as is
python docstrings for the public API contained herein.

Change-Id: I74effcc4a564a92c418132042bbdd5bed22c4950

commit_message:
Fixes type and description for NeutronL3HA

puppet-neutron takes this variable as boolean.  Although it doesn't
change the behavior in master (because the variable is used directly as
config), in mitaka it is used as a conditional and should be properly
fixed.

Also a fix is needed in python-tripleoclient because it is hard coded to
be True there based on number of controllers being greater than 1.
Therefore we shoudl remove that logic from tripleoclient and implement
it in THT.  In order to do that the pacemaker version of the variable is
defaulted to true.

Partial-Bug: 1605379

Change-Id: I0b797dbe188382e2dc32506913aaa60a0a21bd68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8d0497d819a0f7e75eaae8531218ca7890d8ed7b)

added_lines: parameter_defaults: NeutronL3HA: true

commit_message:
Add trunk commands to openstackclient

This patch introduces the client bindings for the trunk
extension. It uses the openstackclient framework, and
thus requires the openstack client to work.

New commands introduced are as follows:
"openstack network trunk create" to create a trunk.
"openstack network trunk set" to update/add subports to a trunk.
"openstack network trunk unset" to remove subports from trunk.
"openstack network trunk list" to list all trunks.
"openstack network trunk delete" to delete trunks.
"openstack subport list --trunk <name>" to list all subports
belonging to a trunk.

DocImpact: Openstackclient now supports CLIs to configure
           trunk resource via OSC plugin for neutronclient

Change-Id: I6fe1dbd81813fae234801a61c0e3d89f9e7c791e
Co-authored-by: SongmingYan <yan.songming@zte.com.cn>
Co-authored-by: Abhishek Raut <rauta@vmware.com>
Partial-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from openstackclient.tests import utils as tests_utils from neutronclient.osc.v2.trunk import trunk from neutronclient.tests.unit.osc.v2 import fakes as test_fakes from neutronclient.tests.unit.osc.v2.trunk import fakes class TestCreateTrunk(test_fakes.TestNeutronClientOSCV2): # The new trunk created _trunk = fakes.FakeTrunk.create_one_trunk() columns = ( 'id', 'name', 'port', 'project_id', ) data = ( _trunk.id, _trunk.name, _trunk.port_id, _trunk.tenant_id, ) def setUp(self): super(TestCreateTrunk, self).setUp() self.neutronclient.create_trunk = mock.Mock(return_value=self._trunk) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = trunk.CreateTrunk(self.app, self.namespace) def test_create_default_options(self): arglist = [ self._trunk.port_id, ] verifylist = [ ('port', self._trunk.port_id), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = (self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args)) self.neutronclient.create_trunk.assert_called_once_with(**{ 'port': self._trunk.port_id }) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, data) def test_create_full_options(self): arglist = [ '--name', self._trunk.name, self._trunk.port_id, ] verifylist = [ ('name', self._trunk.name), ('port', self._trunk.port_id), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = (self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args)) self.neutronclient.create_trunk.assert_called_once_with(**{ 'name': self._trunk.name, 'port': self._trunk.port_id }) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, data) class TestDeleteTrunk(test_fakes.TestNeutronClientOSCV2): # The trunk to be deleted. _trunk = fakes.FakeTrunk.create_one_trunk() def setUp(self): super(TestDeleteTrunk, self).setUp() self.neutronclient.delete_trunk = mock.Mock(return_value=None) self.neutronclient.find_trunk = mock.Mock(return_value=self._trunk) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = trunk.DeleteTrunk(self.app, self.namespace) def test_delete(self): arglist = [ self._trunk.name, ] verifylist = [ ('trunk', [self._trunk.name]), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) result = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.neutronclient.delete_trunk.assert_called_once_with(self._trunk) self.assertIsNone(result) class TestShowTrunk(test_fakes.TestNeutronClientOSCV2): # The trunk to set. _trunk = fakes.FakeTrunk.create_one_trunk() columns = ( 'id', 'name', 'port', 'project_id', ) data = ( _trunk.id, _trunk.name, _trunk.port, _trunk.tenant_id, ) def setUp(self): super(TestShowTrunk, self).setUp() self.neutronclient.get_trunk = mock.Mock(return_value=self._trunk) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = trunk.ShowTrunk(self.app, self.namespace) def test_show_no_options(self): arglist = [] verifylist = [] self.assertRaises(tests_utils.ParserException, self.check_parser, self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) def test_show_all_options(self): arglist = [ self._trunk.id, ] verifylist = [ ('trunk', self._trunk.id), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.neutronclient.get_trunk.assert_called_once_with( self._trunk.id, ignore_missing=False) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, data)

commit_message:
Support callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent

Agentless L3 plugins, such as used by networking-ovn, were required
to inherit from L3_NAT_db_mixin instead of L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin due
to an L3 NAT DB signature mismatch which was fixed by [1]. With [1]
fix, agentless L3 plugins would still implicitly pick up callbacks
intended for use by L3 agents. Such callbacks will fail unless the
L3 plugin inherits from L3_NAT_db_mixin. This patch supports
callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent. The callbacks
have been refactored and are now done implicitly during object
creation. As a result, the l3_db subscribe() method has been
deprecated.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348558/

Change-Id: Id5dd012ffd274314f7d1b39a28525893e0675500
Partial-Bug: #1597898

commit_message:
Update address set with security group name update

Update the address set external IDs when a security group is
updated. This ensures that the address set has the correct
security group name stored.

Change-Id: Ie2e1ee43cdb19f9d8c90b6144a73ce9fe5a1984a
Related-Bug: #1560817
