commit_message:
Add token feature support matrix to documentation

This introduces a feature support matrix to illustrate which of our
various token providers supports which API operations and features. This
is intended to mirror Nova's feature support matrix documentation page,
found here:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html

After running `tox -e docs`, the result is embedded in
`doc/build/html/configuration.html`.

Change-Id: I3dc896a2906e25827a9e01afc7de5a737831c336

commit_message:
Refactor fix magic in get_one_cloud()

Extract the magic argument fixes from get_ne_cloud() so they can be
extended or modified.

Needed by OSC in order to maintain compatibility due to the much
earlier loading of auth plugins than before.  Have I mentioned
that really fouled things up for OSC?

Change-Id: I22cd890f9cbd605dcd615f82b3e65c58f52ff114
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/18/331418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStackClient will override this to perform additional checks def magic_fixes(self, config): """Perform the set of magic argument fixups""" # Infer token plugin if a token was given if (('auth' in config and 'token' in config['auth']) or ('auth_token' in config and config['auth_token']) or ('token' in config and config['token'])): config.setdefault('token', config.pop('auth_token', None)) # These backwards compat values are only set via argparse. If it's # there, it's because it was passed in explicitly, and should win config = self._fix_backwards_api_timeout(config) if 'endpoint_type' in config: config['interface'] = config.pop('endpoint_type') config = self._fix_backwards_auth_plugin(config) config = self._fix_backwards_project(config) config = self._fix_backwards_interface(config) config = self._fix_backwards_networks(config) config = self._handle_domain_id(config) for key in BOOL_KEYS: if key in config: if type(config[key]) is not bool: config[key] = get_boolean(config[key]) # TODO(mordred): Special casing auth_url here. We should # come back to this betterer later so that it's # more generalized if 'auth' in config and 'auth_url' in config['auth']: config['auth']['auth_url'] = config['auth']['auth_url'].format( **config) return config config = self.magic_fixes(config)
deleted_lines: def _fix_backwards_madness(self, cloud): cloud = self._fix_backwards_auth_plugin(cloud) cloud = self._fix_backwards_project(cloud) cloud = self._fix_backwards_interface(cloud) cloud = self._fix_backwards_networks(cloud) cloud = self._handle_domain_id(cloud) return cloud OpenStackClient will override this to perform additional chacks # Infer token plugin if a token was given if (('auth' in config and 'token' in config['auth']) or ('auth_token' in config and config['auth_token']) or ('token' in config and config['token'])): config.setdefault('token', config.pop('auth_token', None)) # These backwards compat values are only set via argparse. If it's # there, it's because it was passed in explicitly, and should win config = self._fix_backwards_api_timeout(config) if 'endpoint_type' in config: config['interface'] = config.pop('endpoint_type') config = self._fix_backwards_madness(config) for key in BOOL_KEYS: if key in config: if type(config[key]) is not bool: config[key] = get_boolean(config[key]) # TODO(mordred): Special casing auth_url here. We should # come back to this betterer later so that it's # more generalized if 'auth' in config and 'auth_url' in config['auth']: config['auth']['auth_url'] = config['auth']['auth_url'].format( **config)

commit_message:
Add support for listing a cloud as shut down

We've had one vendor cloud go away in the past, and there is one
existing deprecated cloud currently. Add support for providing the
user with an informative error message in the case where they
attempt to use such a cloud.

Change-Id: I894e0c0a4786e60fce1238bb2883828e89d44b01

commit_message:
Add support for deprecating cloud profiles

We've had HP shut down their public cloud, and DreamHost has recent spun
up a new cloud with a different operational profile and auth_url that is
essentially a replacement cloud. That means people using the old
information need to do things, so we need to be able to communicate that
to them.

Add support for adding a deprecated status to a vendor profile, as well
as a verbose message explaining what the user may do to remediate.

Change-Id: I19b67d7cd71fba2d9da0e3a6adb2d229ead65396

commit_message:
Adding new DreamHost Cloud cluster

DreamHost added a new cluster in April 2016, it's a separate OpenStack installation
from previous one, therefore we need to add a new entry for clarity.

Change-Id: Iffa644cfb5bc5a464fef39551203d3dbafe80c9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/32/337832/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dreamhost (beta) ---------------- https://keystone.dream.io/v2.0 ============== ================ Region Name Human Name ============== ================ RegionOne Region One ============== ================ * Images must be in `raw` format * Public IPv4 is provided via NAT with Neutron Floating IP * IPv6 is provided to every server https://iad2.dream.io:5000

commit_message:
doc-tools unit tests

Renamed sitemap file to avoid module name conflict
when importing at the sitemap unittest

Added py.test tox environment

Change-Id: I94480e374b29802414b62591a51c04ecd804905e
Closes-Bug: #1387716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/22/284122/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import unittest from generator.pipelines import ( scrapy, ExportSitemap, IgnoreDuplicateUrls, SitemapItemExporter ) class TestSitemapItemExporter(unittest.TestCase): def test_start_exporting(self): output = mock.MagicMock() itemExplorer = SitemapItemExporter(output) with mock.patch.object(itemExplorer.xg, 'startDocument', return_value=None) as mock_start_document: with mock.patch.object(itemExplorer.xg, 'startElement', return_value=None) as mock_start_element: itemExplorer.start_exporting() self.assertTrue(mock_start_document.called) self.assertTrue(mock_start_element.called) class TestIgnoreDuplicateUrls(unittest.TestCase): def test_set_is_set_at_init(self): ignore_urls = IgnoreDuplicateUrls() self.assertTrue(isinstance(ignore_urls.processed, set)) def test_set_is_empty_at_init(self): ignore_urls = IgnoreDuplicateUrls() self.assertEqual(len(ignore_urls.processed), 0) def test_duplicate_url(self): ignore_urls = IgnoreDuplicateUrls() ignore_urls.processed.add('url') item = {'loc': 'url'} spider = mock.MagicMock() with self.assertRaises(scrapy.exceptions.DropItem): ignore_urls.process_item(item, spider) def test_url_added_to_processed(self): ignore_urls = IgnoreDuplicateUrls() self.assertFalse('url' in ignore_urls.processed) item = {'loc': 'url'} spider = mock.MagicMock() ignore_urls.process_item(item, spider) self.assertTrue('url' in ignore_urls.processed) def test_item_is_returned(self): ignore_urls = IgnoreDuplicateUrls() item = {'loc': 'url'} spider = mock.MagicMock() returned_item = ignore_urls.process_item(item, spider) self.assertEqual(item, returned_item) class TestExportSitemap(unittest.TestCase): def test_variables_set_at_init(self): export_sitemap = ExportSitemap() self.assertTrue(isinstance(export_sitemap.files, dict)) self.assertTrue(export_sitemap.exporter is None) if __name__ == '__main__': unittest.main()

subject: Import quota name dicts from python-openstackclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-04 12:41:15.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/quotas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/62d6fcd616144646cf0b476155632e3e88c27591', 'message': 'Import quota name dicts from python-openstackclient

These are more broadly useful outside of the context of the command line
tool. Put them here so that python-openstackclient can still use them,
but so that other things can too.

Change-Id: Ied4cea9e31cbc834fd0693410f7164629fe046df
'}]
commit_message:
Import quota name dicts from python-openstackclient

These are more broadly useful outside of the context of the command line
tool. Put them here so that python-openstackclient can still use them,
but so that other things can too.

Change-Id: Ied4cea9e31cbc834fd0693410f7164629fe046df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/84/312484/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # List the quota items, map the internal argument name to the option # name that the user sees. COMPUTE_QUOTAS = { 'cores': 'cores', 'fixed_ips': 'fixed-ips', 'floating_ips': 'floating-ips', 'injected_file_content_bytes': 'injected-file-size', 'injected_file_path_bytes': 'injected-path-size', 'injected_files': 'injected-files', 'instances': 'instances', 'key_pairs': 'key-pairs', 'metadata_items': 'properties', 'ram': 'ram', 'security_group_rules': 'secgroup-rules', 'security_groups': 'secgroups', } VOLUME_QUOTAS = { 'gigabytes': 'gigabytes', 'snapshots': 'snapshots', 'volumes': 'volumes', } NETWORK_QUOTAS = { 'floatingip': 'floating-ips', 'security_group_rule': 'secgroup-rules', 'security_group': 'secgroups', }

Start importing the TripleO Ansible validations from Clapper repository
[1] into tripleo-validations.

This commit lays down the structure for the ansible validations and

dynamic inventory script to access all nodes in the TripleO deployment.

Next commits will import existing validations one by one.

commit_message:
Documentation how validations work

Start importing the TripleO Ansible validations from Clapper repository
[1] into tripleo-validations.

This commit lays down the structure for the ansible validations and
documents how to write and run validations.

Next commits will import existing validations one by one.

[1] https://github.com/rthallisey/clapper

Change-Id: I946d4e61bda1382c5299c7494fb994d870cdc56b
Co-Authored-By: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>

added_lines: # Your undercloud servers. This can be `localhost` if you cloned the # repository on the undercloud: [undercloud] undercloud.example.com [undercloud:vars] #controller_vip= [overcloud:children] controller compute [controller] controller.example.com [controller:vars] #put username here if different than compute nodes, ie stack user ##ansible_ssh_user=stack [compute] compute-1.example.com compute-2.example.com [compute:vars] #put username here if different than compute nodes, ie stack user ##ansible_ssh_user=heat-admin [all:vars] # Username to SSH as: ansible_ssh_user=stack # Set to `true` if the SSH user is not root. Ansible will run `sudo` # for commands requiring root: ansible_sudo=true

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 14:54:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder/commit/95a87e9656ada4b3a0df012fdcf077804de77808', 'message': 'WIP - Configure keystone authtoken options

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 15:36:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder/commit/fca069d3fc3d66150978ae718dbad4e5ad722a2d', 'message': 'Configure keystone authtoken options

In cinder::api, use keystone::resource::authtoken to configure
keystone_authtoken section in cinder.conf, with all parameters required
to configure keystonemiddleware.
This patch will allow to deploy Cinder to use Keystone v3
authentification.

Some deprecations:
- cinder::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of cinder::api::project_name.
- cinder::api::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of cinder::api::username.
- cinder::api::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of cinder::api::password.
- cinder::api::identity_uri is deprecated in favor of cinder::api::auth_uri.

The patch is backward compatible and keep defaults values like before.

Change-Id: I64736457bd8527198a8a81ea784d3bf74284063b
Depends-On: I4bd8cd22eafe6650511aa745fc400a6c4d36b512

In cinder::api, use keystone::resource::authtoken to configure
keystone_authtoken section in cinder.conf, with all parameters required
to configure keystonemiddleware.
This patch will allow to deploy Cinder to use Keystone v3
authentification.

Some deprecations:
cinder::api::auth_type is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_type instead.
cinder::api::identity_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_url instead.
cinder::api::auth_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri instead.
cinder::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::project_name instead.
cinder::api::keystone_user is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::username instead.
cinder::api::keystone_password is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::password instead.
cinder::api::memcached_servers is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::memcached_servers instead.

Closes-Bug: #1604463
Change-Id: I64736457bd8527198a8a81ea784d3bf74284063b

commit_message:
Configure keystone authtoken options

In cinder::api, use keystone::resource::authtoken to configure
keystone_authtoken section in cinder.conf, with all parameters required
to configure keystonemiddleware.
This patch will allow to deploy Cinder to use Keystone v3
authentification.

Some deprecations:
cinder::api::auth_type is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_type instead.
cinder::api::identity_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_url instead.
cinder::api::auth_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri instead.
cinder::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::project_name instead.
cinder::api::keystone_user is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::username instead.
cinder::api::keystone_password is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::password instead.
cinder::api::memcached_servers is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::memcached_servers instead.

Closes-Bug: #1604463
Change-Id: I64736457bd8527198a8a81ea784d3bf74284063b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/05/342905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

"strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. commit_message:
Revert 372057bddb27716acd42a88591552a8dee7b519b

"Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields"

This patch caused updated that had an empty records array (i.e. not sent in the json request) to remove all records from a recordset.

http://logs.openstack.org/24/350024/1/check/gate-shade-dsvm-functional-nova/fe8727c/console.html#_2016-08-02_14_51_48_101643

This reverts commit 372057bddb27716acd42a88591552a8dee7b519b.

Change-Id: Ie10099430481ffa76f5a19557e3693189544df6b

deleted_lines: from designate.objects.adapters import DesignateAdapter def test_parse_rrset_object_preserves_changes(self): old_ip = '1.1.1.1' new_ip = '8.8.8.8' original_records = objects.RecordList( objects=[ objects.Record(data=old_ip), ] ) rs = objects.RecordSet( name='www.example.org.', type='A', records=original_records ) body = { 'records': [ new_ip ] } rs = DesignateAdapter.parse('API_v2', body, rs) self.assertIn('records', rs.obj_what_changed()) def get_data(record_list): return set([r.data for r in record_list]) self.assertEqual(set([old_ip]), get_data(rs.obj_get_original_value('records'))) self.assertEqual(set([new_ip]), get_data(rs.obj_get_changes()['records'])) def test_parse_rrset_object_preserves_changes_multiple_rrs(self): old_ips = ['1.1.1.1', '2.2.2.2'] new_ips = ['2.2.2.2', '8.8.8.8'] original_records = objects.RecordList( objects=[ objects.Record(data=ip) for ip in old_ips ] ) rs = objects.RecordSet( name='www.example.org.', type='A', records=original_records ) body = { 'records': new_ips } rs = DesignateAdapter.parse('API_v2', body, rs) self.assertIn('records', rs.obj_what_changed()) def get_data(record_list): return set([r.data for r in record_list]) self.assertEqual(set(old_ips), get_data(rs.obj_get_original_value('records'))) self.assertEqual(set(new_ips), get_data(rs.obj_get_changes()['records']))

Adds Default Logins to Templates

Added a new section cloud-user with type string to the schema
Added a new section to the index to display the cloud-user if declared

Change-Id: I5ddd2c50cba901c0a8da79bd54ebaf6518bc02d4

commit_message:
Remove configuration references to eventlet

There were still a couple references remaining for using keystone
under eventlet. These are no longer applicable since keystone is
no longer supported under eventlet.

Change-Id: If6d2013cc2396d6d1df43f7f2091b5fa02115ca4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/55/348555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. WARNING:: It is recommended you use the ``memcache_pool`` backend instead of ``memcache`` as the token persistence driver if you are deploying Keystone under eventlet instead of Apache httpd with ``mod_wsgi``. This recommendation is due to known issues with the use of ``thread.local`` under eventlet that can allow the leaking of memcache client objects and consumption of extra sockets. .. WARNING:: Do not use ``dogpile.cache.memcached`` backend if you are deploying Keystone under eventlet. There are known issues with the use of ``thread.local`` under eventlet that can allow the leaking of memcache client objects and consumption of extra sockets.

commit_message:
Port device events for common agent

Some of the agent code may want to receive events whenever
a device is added/updated/deleted. Currently the only way
to do that is to modify the loop directly or create an
extension. Neither of these options are good if it's code
we don't want users to disable (the extensions) and it's
specific to one agent (so we don't want to modify the loop).

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I3468c7f46cc1b4000cdd537e8f216d207a14727a

commit_message:
[docs] Revise deployment configuration chapter

Reorganised content based on feedback and IA proposal in
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/osa-install-guide-IA:

1. Move affinity content to the appendix
2. Move security hardening configuration to the appendix
3. Create an advanced configuration section in the appendix
4. Delete configuring hosts and configuring target host networking information,
and create a configuration file examples section
5. Move glance configuration information to the developer docs
6. Move overridding configuration defaults to the appendix.
7. Move checking configuration file content to the installation chapter

Change-Id: I71efaf2472b1233f1b1a1367fcb00ca598d27ea9
Implements: blueprint osa-install-guide-overhaul

commit_message:
Make pseudo tool handle plurals better

Right now the pseudo tool creates an uncompilable po file
if a plural message has extra parameters in the plural form
that don't exist in the singular form.

Update the tool to base plural messages on the original plural
form so that the expected parameters will always be present.

Change-Id: I1910478136001720f97e1f531a03be28e185d99c
Closes-bug: 1563005

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ie5e69a7e67aa0ed094f09e44a2659501d99cf667
Closes-bug: #1604734

commit_message:
Display Python error in multiple lines

In the details of an instance which failed, details of errors were on
one line. Now, the readability is improved by splitting them in multiple
lines.

Change-Id: Ie8371568cee119f3455d164c86106d81ecbec63d
Closes-Bug: #1348706

commit_message:
Hide access and security panel if no nova

If nova isn't available in a region, Horizon will
show an error page/failure in the access and
security panel. Although there are other panels that
don't work without nova, they just show a proper
error message.

Update the panel definiton so that access and security
is shown only when nova is available.

Change-Id: Ie292dc97a4e80b86cd52c66b28b1fd467e303067
Closes-bug: 1498403

commit_message:
Fixes Error message during instance snapshot creation.

While creating a snapshot of an instance, if you give a name which is
less than 256 characters, but more than 256 bytes, glance gives the
correct error-> "Image name too long" but it doesn't propagate to the
horizon. So, this patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I50d8a27c2545e802482e5ac6c80eb45a659cd312
Closes-bug: #1412882

commit_message:
The flavors in resize workflow should be form choice format

While there is only one flavor in instance resize form, it
will raise `'Flavor' object is not iterable` while resize
instance, the patch fix it.

steps to reproduce:

1. demo user only can access the two flavors(m1.tiny and m1.small)
2. launch instance001 with flavor m1.tiny
3. try to resize instance001, the horizon will raise "'Flavor' object is not iterable"

Change-Id: I05915be8b7e8b8d528332968c67c0223ca8db35c
Closes-Bug: #1506488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/80/235380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: flavor = flavors[0] flavors = [(flavor.id, flavor.name)]

Bump python-ironicclient minimum to 1.6.0

There's some nova features that hard-depend on this version, bump the
minimum.

commit_message:
Don't assume an eth1

Not all cloud providers (osic and ovh in particular) spawn instances
with an eth0 and eth1, so don't assume an eth1 exists when finding it's
ip address to add to $no_proxy.

This recently started failing when we merged:
I2b84b3dfae60bbe7d6a76259b1d718b7dda08739

which added set -o pipefail to toci_instack_osinfra.sh and passed CI
when it ran on a different provider (rax).

Change-Id: I601a5e09eafbc1f03d7913ca6ffc060e3d774a44
Closes-Bug: #1609357

deleted_lines: MY_IP_eth1=$(ip addr show dev eth1 | awk '/inet / {gsub("/.*", "") ; print $2}')

commit_message:
Update documentation for permissions on dashboards

Permissions was inadequately documented, needs updating to provide
examples of OR and AND logic.

Change-Id: I033bb164c75722555faedc21465bc9dd9eb20432
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/52/230652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A list of permission names, which a user must possess in order The permissions check is a logical AND of all top level permissions. Will use logical OR for all first level tuples (check that user has one permissions in the tuple) Examples: Checks for all required permissions, admin AND L3:: ('openstack.roles.admin', 'openstack.roles.L3-support') Checks for admin OR L3:: (('openstack.roles.L3-support','openstack.roles.L2-support'),) Checks for admin AND (L2 or L3):: ('openstack.roles.admin', ('openstack.roles.L3-support','openstack.roles.L2-support'),) permissions are either roles or services.
deleted_lines: A list of permission names, all of which a user must possess in order

commit_message:
Policy should support AND and OR checks for panels

Allowing for more complex combinations of policy checks.
Will check for logical OR of all top level permissions.
Will use logical AND for all first level tuples (check
that use has all the  permissions in the tuple list)

Examples:
T = Policy Rule Tuple.

Checks for ALL required permissions
([T1, T2, T3],) => T1 AND T2 AND T3

Checks for T1 OR (T2 AND T3)
(T1, [T2, T3],) => T1 OR (T2 AND T3)

Change-Id: I86e95cc9a22d7ef68ddaf37cfc5f36884cc7c35d
Closes-Bug: #1426415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/94/168894/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: access = True # Deny access if policy_check function fails for # any rule in policy_rules if not policy_check((rule,), request): access = False return access
deleted_lines: # this check is an OR check rather than an AND check that is the # default in the policy engine, so calling each rule individually if policy_check((rule,), request): return True return False return True

subject: Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 21:21:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/9075847e75bb62024e2da7ecebc2c58b3af02d3d', 'message': 'WIP: Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address, memcached pools, and glance registry
host so that Kubernetes can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * I'm going to keep this WIP until I've got a patch up to fix net=host for
   the Glance containers.  After that, a 0.0.0.0 interface is totally OK
   in the Kubernetes world because the network fabric controls access.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.

Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-22 21:16:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/3fd268078089ed9485200ac368e54653b8b0d4d8', 'message': 'Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * This depends on a kolla-kubernetes patch, so that it won't be merged

Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887

glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * This depends on a kolla-kubernetes patch, so that it won't be merged
   until it's safe for glance to bind to 0.0.0.0.  It's OK to bind to
   0.0.0.0 in the Kubernetes world because the network fabric controls
   access.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
Depends-On: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0
'}]
commit_message:
Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address, memcached pools, and glance registry
host so that Kubernetes can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * This depends on a kolla-kubernetes patch, so that it won't be merged
   until it's safe for glance to bind to 0.0.0.0.  It's OK to bind to
   0.0.0.0 in the Kubernetes world because the network fabric controls
   access.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
Depends-On: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/81/332481/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bind_host = {{ api_interface_address }}registry_host = {{ glance_registry_host }}auth_uri = {{ keystone_public_url }} auth_url = {{ keystone_admin_url }}{# For Kolla-Ansible, generate the memcache servers based on the list of memcached servers in the inventory and memcached_servers should be un-set. For Kolla-Kubernetes, it is necessary to define the memcached_servers variable in globals.yml to set it to the Kubernetes service for memcached. #}{% if memcached_servers is defined %} memcache_servers = {{ memcached_servers }} {% else %}{%- endif %}
deleted_lines: bind_host = {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + api_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }}registry_host = {{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}auth_uri = {{ internal_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_public_port }} auth_url = {{ admin_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ keystone_admin_port }}

commit_message:
Horizon interface address and memcached override

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address and memcached pools, so that Kubernetes
can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"

Three tings to note:
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the service is not using net=host, so a
   0.0.0.0 interface address is totally OK.  That patch has been merged.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.
 * In order to not duplicate tons of code, moved the keystone_admin_url /
   keystone_internal_url / keystone_public_url to the common defaults
   from the keystone defaults.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/28/330828/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {# For Kolla-Ansible, generate the memcache servers based on the list of memcached servers in the inventory and memcached_servers should be un-set. For Kolla-Kubernetes, it is necessary to define the memcached_servers variable in globals.yml to set it to the Kubernetes service for memcached. #}{% if memcached_servers is defined %} 'LOCATION': '{{ memcached_servers }}', {% else %}{%- endif %}OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL = "{{ keystone_public_url }}"

commit_message:
Fix interface address for memcached atop kubernetes

commit_message:
Fix uuid to UUID in expected error messages

This commit c5a738524264f76266fe9435856e425f8a5ece72 into Ironic
changed lower case uuid to upper case UUID in the error messages. Some
tests in ironicclient relied on matching a error message output and were
broken by this change.

Change-Id: Ib0364d41773042f2953652c56dded5e1bb9844e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/22/350522/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ex_text = r'Expected a UUID but received {0}'.format(invalid_uuid)
deleted_lines: ex_text = r'Expected a uuid but received {0}'.format(invalid_uuid)

Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. # # we do not used -W here because we are doing some slightly tricky # things to build a single page document, and as such, we are ok # ignoring the duplicate stanzas warning. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} commands = rm -rf api-ref/build sphinx-build -W -b html -d api-ref/build/doctrees api-ref/source api-ref/build/html

Related blueprint ui-custom-graph

added_lines: import FileSaver from 'file-saver'; import dispatcher from 'dispatcher'; export var DownloadFileButton = React.createClass({ propTypes: { label: React.PropTypes.string.isRequired, fileName: React.PropTypes.string.isRequired, fileType: React.PropTypes.oneOf(['json', 'csv']), fileContent: React.PropTypes.func, url: React.PropTypes.string, className: React.PropTypes.string }, getDefaultProps() { return { fileType: 'json' }; }, downloadFile() { var {url, fileType, fileContent} = this.props; if (url) { dispatcher.trigger('pageLoadStarted'); $.ajax({ url, dataType: {json: 'json', csv: 'text'}[fileType], headers: {'X-Auth-Token': app.keystoneClient.token} }).then( (response) => { this.saveFile(response); dispatcher.trigger('pageLoadFinished'); }, (response) => { utils.showErrorDialog({ title: i18n('dialog.file_download_error.title'), response }); } ); } else { this.saveFile(fileContent()); } }, saveFile(fileContent) { var {fileType, fileName} = this.props; var processors = { json: (data) => JSON.stringify(data, null, 2), csv: _.identity }; var blob = new Blob( [processors[fileType](fileContent)], { type: {json: 'application/json', csv: 'text/csv'}[fileType] } ); FileSaver.saveAs(blob, fileName); }, render() { var {label, className} = this.props; return ( <button className={utils.classNames('btn btn-default', className)} onClick={this.downloadFile} > {label} </button> ); } });

commit_message:
Fix broken gate

Keystone service create don't accept None as service type
it should be always string.
Add unit test for that case.

Change-Id: Idee26da8e5b1905d270ac3f1d3154dd343a8dbe2

commit_message:
Render rabbit SSL config

* Add SSL properties to RabbitMQRelationAdapter for rendering amqp
  config with SSL options.
* When configuring SSL write out Rabbit CA cert if available
* Look for identity-service ssl configured state if keystone
  interface has not been explicitly passed in. This simplifies the
  SSL configure call in the charm.
* Use contextmanager to check for CA cert change and only run
  update-ca-certificates if a change was detected. While
  update-ca-certificates is running access to remote endpoints
  using SSL is liable to fail as CA certs are unavailable to
  verify remote certs.

Change-Id: I6b7dcfa13dada45de0399aa17677ee6bf5b7be65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/52/348852/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import charms.reactive as reactive reactive.bus.set_state(state, value) reactive.bus.remove_state(state) return reactive.bus.get_state(state) available_states = reactive.bus.get_states().keys() @property def rabbit_client_cert_dir(self): return '/etc/rabbitmq/' @property def rabbit_cert_file(self): return '{}/rabbit-client-ca.pem'.format(self.rabbit_client_cert_dir) amqp_ssl = reactive.RelationBase.from_state('amqp.available.ssl') if amqp_ssl: self.configure_rabbit_cert(amqp_ssl) def configure_rabbit_cert(self, rabbit_interface): if not os.path.exists(self.rabbit_client_cert_dir): os.mkdir(self.rabbit_client_cert_dir) with open(self.rabbit_cert_file, 'w') as crt: crt.write(rabbit_interface.get_ssl_cert())
deleted_lines: import charms.reactive.bus charms.reactive.bus.set_state(state, value) charms.reactive.bus.remove_state(state) return charms.reactive.bus.get_state(state) available_states = charms.reactive.bus.get_states().keys()

commit_message:
AMQP 1.0 Driver Architecture Overview Document

Architecture overview document to convey primary capabilities,
functional composition and dynamic behavior of oslo_messaging_amqp driver.

Change-Id: Ic108da7a13d3d822a6751a15bae3b59a3243d366
Closes-Bug: #1596642
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/66/340966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ############################## Oslo.messaging AMQP 1.0 Driver ############################## :Date: $Date: 2016-07-11 $ :Revision: $Revision: 0.02 $ Introduction ============ This document describes the architecture and implementation of the olso.messaging AMQP 1.0 driver. This architecture overview is intended to provide a shared understanding of the driver functionality and composition through a number of architectural views that link the driver activities to components and dynamic interactions. Driver Overview =============== :: +------------+ +------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ | | | | | | | | OpenStack | RPC Client | | RPC Server | | Notify | | Notify | Application | | | | | Client | | Server | +------------+ +------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | Oslo.Messaging "Base Driver Interface" | Oslo Messaging +-----------------------------------------------------------+ Driver | Oslo.Messaging AMQP 1.0 Driver | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | Pyngus Messaging Framework | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | QPID Proton Library | AMQP 1.0 +-----------------------------------------------------------+ Protocol | AMQP 1.0 Protocol | Exchange +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | TCP/IP Network Layer | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ The AMQP 1.0 driver provides an implementation of the olso.messaging base driver service interfaces that map client application RPC and Notify methods "onto" the operation of an AMQP 1.0 protocol messaging bus. The blueprint for the original driver can be found here [1]_ and the original implementation is described in [2]_. The feature specification for the updates to the AMQP 1.0 driver for the OpenStack Newton release can be found here [3]_ The driver effectively hides the details of the AMQP 1.0 protocol transport and message processing from the client applications. This abstraction is primarily realized by the Pyngus messaging framework [4]_ built on the QPID Proton engine [5]_ for a callback-based API for message passing. While the operation of the layers that support the AMQP 1.0 Protocol Exchange directly influence the driver architecture, the detailed operation of these underlying layers is outside the scope of this architecture narrative. :: subcribe +------------+ invoke * * <-----------+------------+ | |-----------> * AMQP * request | | | RPC Client | reply * 1.0 *--------->| RPC Server | | |<---------- * Driver * reply | | +------------+ * *<----------+------------+ * * ^ | received message | sent message | delivery state | tranfer credit | v +-----------------+ | AMQP 1.0 | | Protocol | | Exchange | | (Messaging Bus) | +-----------------+ OpenStack applications are the primary actors on the oslo messaging RPC and Notify driver interfaces. The control and data flows implemented in the AMQP 1.0 driver connect the user (e.g. sources and sinks) of the system together through driver subsystems that are defined by the user (e.g. applicatoin) activities. The overall driver composition, capabilities and dynamic behavior are best understood through the primary use scenarios and their mapping onto the AMQP 1.0 protocol exchange. Use Scenarios ------------- :: | | | | | * * | * * * * * * | * * | * * * * * * +------------|-->* Load * | * Prepare * * Retrieve * * Connect * | | * Driver * | * Driver * * Config * * Message * | | * * | * * * * * Bus * | | * * \ | / * * / * * / * * | | \_____|_____/____________/______________/ | | | \ | | | \ * * | | | * * | | | * Address * | | | * Factory * | | | * * | | | * * | | | | | * * | * * * * * * | | * * | * * * * * * | +----------|-->* Subscribe* | * Create * * Create * * Attach * | | | * Server * | * Listener * * Server * * Link * | | | * * | * * * * * * | | | * * \ | / * * / * * / * * | | | \_____|______/____________/_____________/ | | | | | | | * * | * * * * * * | | | * * | * * * * * * | | +-|-->* Send * | * Prepare * * Prepare * * Transfer * | | / | * Message * | * Request * * Response * * Message * | | / | * * | * * * * * * | | / | * * \ | / * * / * * / * * | | / | \_____|_____/____________/______________/ | | / | | * * / | * * | * * * * * AMQP * | * * | * * * * * 1.0 *------|-->* Server * | * Message * * Poll * * Driver * | * Receive * | * Receive * * * * * | * * | * * * * * * \ | * * \ | / * * / * * | \ | \_____|_____/_____________/ | \ | | | \ | * * | * * * * * * | \ | * RPC * | * * * * * * | \+-|-->* Receive * | * Message * * Update * * Accept * | | * Reply * | * Received * * Credit * * Message * | | * * | * * * * * * | | * * \ | / * * / * * / * * | | \_____|____/______________/_____________/ | | | | | * * | * * * * * * | | * * | * * * * * * +----------|-->* Msg * | * Ack * * Release * * Replenish* | * Dispo. * | * Message * * Message * * Link * | * * | * * * * * Credit * | * * \ | / * * / * * / * * | \_____|_____/_____________/_____________/ | | | | The primary use scenarios for the AMQP 1.0 Driver correspond to the activities supported by the oslo messaging base driver interface. These activities include the ability to subscribe RPC and Notify servers as well the ability to send RPC (cast and call) messages and Notify messages into the control plane infrastructure. Following RPC and Notify server processing (e.g. dispatch to the application) the ability to indicate the final disposition of the message is supported and mapped onto the message delivery and settlement capabilities of the AMQP messaging bus. The composition of the AMQP driver and its dynamic behaviors is defined by the support of these primary activities. Load Driver ^^^^^^^^^^^ :: load()---+ \ ----------- \ +--- Transport > * * | ----------- * *<---+ * Prepare * * Driver * * * * * ---------- | Cfg Opts | ----------\ | \ v v * * * * * Retrieve * * Config * * * * * | | v * * +--------------+ * Connect* | AMQP | * to *<----------->| Protocol | * Message * | Exchange | * Bus * +--------------+ * * \ | \ | \ ------------ v +-----> Connection --+ * * ------------ | * * | * Address *<--------------------+ * Factory * * * * * The operational lifecycle of the AMQP 1.0 driver begins when the oslo messaging loads and instantiates the driver process instance for use by an application. To complete this activity, the driver will retrieve the oslo_messaging_amqp configuration options in order to define the driver's run time behaviors. The transport URL specifier provided will be used by the driver to create a connection to the AMQP 1.0 messaging bus. The transport URL is of the form amqp://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN] Where the transport scheme specifies amqp as the backend. It should be noted that oslo.messaging is deprecating the discrete host, port and auth configuraion options [6]_. The AMQP 1.0 driver provides the capability to transform the target specifier provided by an application to an addressing format that can be associated to the sender and receive links that take part in the AMQP protocol exchange. The AMQP 1.0 will classify the intermediary that is providing the connection to the messaging bus (e.g. broker, router, etc.) to select the optimal scheme to use. Subscribe Server ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ :: listen() + \ \ * * \ * * +> * Create * * Listener* * * * * \ ---------- -------- | +-------> Incoming Target -+ | / ---------- -------- \ | +----+ \ v / v * * v * * * Create * * Server * * *\ * * \ ---------- | \ ----------- Connection | +------> Addresses ----------\ | /----------- \ v / v * * / * *<------+ * Attach * * Link * * * * * | | v +--------------+ | AMQP | | Protocol | | Exchange | +--------------+ The AMQP 1.0 driver maintains a set of (RPC or Notification) servers that are created via the subscribe server activity. For each server, the driver will create and attach a set of addresses for the target that corresponds to the server endpoint for an AMQP protcol exchange. A unique ProtonListener (e.g. AMQP 1.0 Reciever Link) is intantiated for each server subcription and the driver will attach event handlers to perform message transport performatives for the link. The driver maintain's a single incoming queue that messages from all attached links will be placed upon. Send Message ^^^^^^^^^^^^ :: send() + -------- \ +--- Target \ * * | -------- \ * *<---+ +> * Prepare * * Request *---+ ------------- /* * +----> Request Msg <-----+ / * * ------------- | ------- <-+ | | Sender | | ------- | | v | * * ------------ | * *---------> Correlation | * Prepare * ------------ | * Response * | * * | * * | | | | | v --------- | * * +---------> Pending | * */ --------- | * Send * | * Message *\ --------- | * * +-----> Unacked <---+ | * * --------- | | | | | | | + v | / +--------------+ * * v | AMQP | * * | Protocol |-----------> * Settle * | Exchange | * Message * +--------------+ * * * * The AMQP 1.0 driver provides the ability to send messages (e.g. RPC Call/Cast or Notify) to a target specified by a client application. The driver maintains a cache of senders corresponding to each unique target that is referenced across the driver lifecycle. For each sender instance, the driver maintains a single receiver (reply) link that will be the incoming link for all RPC reply messages. Prior to sending an RPC call message that expects a reply, the driver will prepare for the response so that the message can be correlated on the reply link to the original outgoing request. Prior to sending the message, the AMQP 1.0 driver will determine if the sender link is active and has enough credits for the transfer to proceed. If it can not send, the driver will retain the pending message for subsequent processing. If the driver determines that it can send the message, it will first check if there are messages pending from previous requests. The driver will service these pending requests in FIFO order and may defer sending the current message if it can not service all the pending requests first. [TODO: this is only for replies, maybe explain there are different send treatments] The AMQP 1.0 driver tracks the settlement status of all messages sent to the messaging bus. For each message sent, the driver will maintain a count of the number of retry attempts made on the message. The driver will re-send a message that is not acknowledged up until the retry limit is reached or a send timeout deadline is reached. Server Receive ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ :: +--------------+ | AMQP | | Protocol | | Exchange | +--------------+ | ^ -------- V | --------- Receiver-+ * * +------- Address -------- \ * * --------- v* Message * * Received* * * * * \ \ ----------------- +------> Incoming Message --+ * * ----------------- | * * | * Poll *<--+ | * * | | * * | | * * +-------------------------+ The AMQP 1.0 driver (via subscribe) maintains a groups of links that receive messages from a set of addresses derived from the targets associated with a Server instantiation. Messages arriving from these links are placed on an incoming message queue for the Server instances. The Poll method on this queue will return the message to the application for subsequent application service dispatching. RPC Reply Receive ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ :: +--------------+ | AMQP | | Protocol | | Exchange | +--------------+ | ----------------- V + ------ Incoming Message * * / ----------------- * *v * Message * * Received*<---+ * * | * * \ | ------------- | \ +---- Correlation V \ ------------- * * \ * * \ --------------- * Update * +------> Reply Message * Credit * --------------- * * * * | V * * * * * Accept * * Message * * * * * | V +--------------+ | AMQP | | Protocol | | Exchange | +--------------+ For each sender, the AMQP 1.0 driver instantiates a single receiving link for the reception of all RPC reply messages. Messages received on this receiving link are routed to the originating caller using the correlation-id embedded in the header of the message itself. To ensure the responsiveness and througput on the shared RPC receiving link, the AMQP 1.0 driver will immediately update the link transfer credits and will acknowledge the successful receipt of the RPC reply. Disposition ^^^^^^^^^^^ :: acknowledge()--------+ requeue() --------+ | | v V * * * * * * * * * Ack * * Requeue * * Message *\ ----* Message * * * \ / * * * * \ / * * | v ------------- v | | Incoming Msg | | / ------------- | | / | v v | +--------------+ | | AMQP |<----------------------------+ | Protocol | | Exchange | +--------------+ For each message provided by the AMQP 1.0 driver to a server application (e.g. RPC or Notify), the delivery disposition of the incoming message can be indicated to the driver. The disposition can either be to acknowledge the message indicating the message was accepted by the application or to requeue the message indicating that application processing could notsuccessfully take place. The driver will initiate the appropriate settlement of the message through an AMQP protocol exchange over the message bus. Non Functional Requirements --------------------------- In addition to the functional capabilities provided by the AMQP 1.0 driver, there are numerous aspects of the system that are relevant for the software architecture. This section documents a summary the meaning and measures for a given quality of the driver but the full detail and measures is outside the scope of this document. * Server * Senders * Receiver Links * Addresses (per server) * Pending sends (no limit) * Unacked per sender (no limit) * Receiveing link credit capacity (server - 500, rpc replies - 100) * Tasks * Task batch size * Message Rate * Byte rate Qualities ^^^^^^^^^ * Performance * Througput * Usability * Security * Message Rate * Data Transfer Constraints ^^^^^^^^^^^ * Number of Servers/Targets * Concurrent Transfers * Listeners * Credits * Outstanding Sends * Num of retries, etc. Principles ^^^^^^^^^^ * AMQP 1.0 abstraction * Pyngus Framework * Intermediary Support - via configuration Driver Structure ================ :: _______________________ / / / Application / / (OpenStack) / /______________________/ | XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX|XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX | +----------+ | Proton | | Driver | +----------+ | +------------+ | Controller | ----| |---- / +------------+ \ / | \ / | \ +---------+ +---------+ +---------+ | Sender |<--| Replies | | Server | | | | | | | +---------+ +---------+ +---------+ | | | | +---------+ +---------+ | | Proton | | Proton | | |Listener | |Listener | | +---------+ +---------+ | | | XXXXXXXXX|XXXXXXXXXXXXX|XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX|XXXXXXXXXXXXX | | | +--------+ +--------+ +--------+ | Send | | Receive| | Receive| | Link | | Link | | Link | +--------+ +--------+ +--------+ The functionality of the AMQP 1.0 driver is implemented across a number of components that encapsulate the mapping of the driver activities onto the AMQP protocol exchange. The *Controller* implements the primary functional logic for the driver and serves as the interface between the driver entry points ( *Proton Driver* ) and the I/O operations associated with sending and receiving messages on links attached to the message bus. Each sending or receiving link is associated with a specific driver activity such as sending an RPC Call/Cast or Notify message, receiving and RPC reply message, or receiving an RPC or Notify server request. Task Orchestration ------------------ :: +------------------------+ +-------------------------------+ | Client Thread | | Driver Invocation Thread | | +--------+ +---------+ | | +------+ +--------+ +-------+ | | |Proton | |Control | | | |Event | |Control | |Pyngus | | | |Driver | |(-ler) | | | |Loop | |(-ler) | |Frmwrk | | | +---+----+ +----+----+ | | +---+--+ +---+----+ +---+---+ | | |create | | | | | | | | |task() | | | | | | | | |---------->| | | | | | | | |add | | | | | | | | |task() | | Request | | | | | | |---------->| | Queue | | | | | | | | enq | +------+ | deq | | | | | | |------|---> |||||+--|---->| exec() | | | | | | | +------+ | |------->| | | | | | | | | |----------|-+ | | | wait() | | | | | Protocol | | | | #-----------|------|------+ | | | Exchange | | | | # | | V | | | | | | | # | | +-----+ | | set() |<---------|-+ | | # | | |Event|<--------|--------| | | | # | | | | | | | | | | # | | +-----+ | | | | | | # | | | | | | | | | #<----------|------|------+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | + + | | + + + | | | | | | | | | +------------------------+ +-------------------------------+ The AMQP 1.0 driver orchestrates and syncrhonizes client application requests across thread processing boundaries. The *Proton Driver* will act as a proxy for each client request and constructs a task request object on the caller's thread via the *Controller*. The task request object contains the necessary information to execute the desired methond on a driver invocation thread of control. This driver invocation thread manages an *Event Loop* that will dequeue requests will execute operations on the *Controller* thus ensuring independent operation from the thread of control of the calling clients. The uniqe task objects provided for driver thread invocation include: * Subscribe Task * Send Task (for RCP Cast or Notify) * RPC Call Task * RPC Reply Task * Message Disposition Task Scheduling - Execution ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ :: +--------------------------------------------+ +----------+ |Client Thread /\ | | | | * * * * * * / v | | + V + listen() | * * * * * * | | |---| Request -------->| * Init *-->* Schedule *-->* Wait * | | |---| Tasks | * * * * * * | | |---| | * * * * * * | | +_|_+ | * * * *\ * * | | V | +------------------|-->| +--------------+ +--------------------------------------------+ | | Eventloop | | | * * | +--------------------------------------------+ | | * * | |Client Thread /\ | | | * Execute * | | * * * * * * / v | | | * * | call() | * * * * * * | | | * * | -------->| * Init *-->* Schedule *-->* Wait * | | | ^ * * \ | | * * * * * * | | | / \ | | * * * * * * | | | / / | | * * * *\ * * | | | \ / | | +------------------|-->| | \ * *v | +--------------------------------------------+ | | * * | o | | * Protocol * | o | | * Exchange * | o | | * * | +--------------------------------------------+ | | * * | |Client Thread /\ | | +--------------+ | * * * * * * / v | | cast() | * * * * * * | | -------->| * Init *-->* Schedule *-->* Wait * | | | * * * * * * | | | * * * * * * | | | * * * *\ * * | | | +------------------|--> +--------------------------------------------+ Following the method task construction, the task is added to the *Controller* queue of requests for execution. Following the placement of the task on this queue, the caller will wait for the execution to complete (or possibly timeout or exception). The eventloop running in its own thread will dequeue the task request and invoke the corresponding method on the *Controller* servant using the information stored in the task request object retrieved. The calls executed on this eventloop thread via the *Controller* perform all the protocol specific intelligence required for the pyngus framework. In addition to the target method invocation, the eventloop may call on the request object for message communication state changes or other indications from the peer. Completion ^^^^^^^^^^ After carrying out the messaging protocol exchange for the requested task or upon a timeout/exception condition, the eventloop thread will wakeup the callers thread to indicate the task completion. Driver Components ----------------- This section describes the components of the AMQP 1.0 driver implementation. For each component, its primary responsibilties and the relashionships to other components are included. These relationships derived from service requests placed upon the other components. Architectural or system-level constraints on the component (e.g. multiplicty, concurrency, parameterization) that change the depiction of the architecutre are included. Additionally, any list of issues waiting resolution are described. Controller ^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *Controller* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for performaning messaging-related | | | operations requested by the driver (tasks) | | | and for managing the connection to the messaging | | | service provided by the AMQP 1.0 intermediaries. | | | | | | This component provide the logic or addressing, | | | sending and receiving messages as well as managing | | | the messaging bus connection lifecycle. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | Sender (pyngus.SenderEventHandler) | | | | | | Server (pyngus.ReceiverEventHandler) | | | | | | Replies (pyngus.ReceiverEventHandler) | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created whenever the driver is instantiated | | | in a client application process. The component | | | will terminate the driver operation when the client| | | initiates a shutdown of the driver. | | | | | | All AMQP 1.0 protocol exchanged (e.g. messaging | | | and I/O work are done the Eventloop driver | | | invocation thread. This allows the driver to run | | | asynchronously from the messaging clients. | | | | | | The component supports addressing modes defined | | | by the driver configuration and through dynamic | | | inspection of the connection to the messaging | | | intermediary. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | A cached of sender links indexed by address is | | | maintained. Currently, removal from the cache is | | | is not implemented. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ Sender ^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *Sender* (pyngus.SenderEventHander) | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for managing a sender link lifecycle | | | and queueing/tracking the message delivery. An | | | implementation of Pyngus.SenderEventHandler. | | | | | | Provides the capabilities for sending to a | | | particular address on the message bus. | | | | | | Provides the capability to queue (pending) | | | SendTasks when link not active or insufficient | | | link credit capacity. | | | | | | Provides the capability to retry send following a | | | recoverable connection or link failure. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Addresser | | | Connection | | | Pyngus.Link | | | SendTask | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created by the Controller on a client caller | | | thread and retained on cachec of senders. | | | | | | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | Sender cache aging (see above) | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ Server ^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *Server* (pyngus.ReceiverEventHander) | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for operations for the lifecycle of an | | | incoming queue that is used for messages received | | | from a set of target addresses. | | | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | Connection | | | PyngusLink | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created whenever a client application | | | subscribes a RPC or Notification server to the | | | messaging bus. When the client application closes | | | the transport, this component and its associated | | | links will be detatched/closed. | | | | | | Individual receiver links are created over the | | | message bus connection for all the addresses | | | generated for the server target. | | | | | | All the receiver links share a single event | | | callback handler. | | | | | | TBD - discuss failover | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | The credit per link is presently hardcoded. A | | | mechanism to monitor for a back-up of inbound | | | messages to backpressure the sender is proposed. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ Replies ^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *Replies* (pyngus.ReceiverEventHander) | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for the operations and managing | | | the lifecycle of the receiver link for all all RPC | | | reply messages. A single intance of an RPC reply | | | link is maintained for the driver. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | Connection | | | PyngusLink | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | The reply link is created when the connection to | | | the messaging bus is activated. | | | | | | The origination of RPC calls is inhibited until | | | the replies link is active. | | | | | | Message are routed to the originators incoming | | | queue using the correlation-id header that is | | | contained in the response message. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ ProtonDriver ^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *ProtonDriver* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for providing the oslo.Messaging | | | BaseDriver implementation. | | | | | | Provides the capabilities to send RPC and | | | Notification messages and create subscriptions for | | | the application. | | | | | | Each operation generates a task that is scheduled | | | for execution onf the Controller eventloop thread. | | | The calling thread blocks until execution completes| | | or timeout. | | | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Controller | | | RPCCallTask | | | SendTask | | | SubscribeTask | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created whenever the oslo.messaging AMQP 1.0 | | | driver is loaded by an application (process). | | | | | | The component manages the lifecycle of the | | | Controller component. Tasks may be created but will| | | not be processed until the Controller connection to| | | the messaging service completes. | | | | | | There are separate timeout values for RPC Send, | | | Notify Send, and RPC Call Reply. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | | | The reply, send and notify timeout values should | | | be made configurable (lp#) | | | | | | The unmarshalling of an RPC response could cause | | | and exception/failure and should be optimally | | | communicated back up to the caller. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ ProtonIncomingMessage ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *ProtonIncomingMessage* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for managing the lifecycle of an | | | incoming message received on a RPC or notification | | | Server link. | | | | | | Provides the capability to set the disposition of | | | the incoming message as acknowledge (e.g. settled) | | | or requeue. | | | | | | Provides the cability to marshal and send the | | | reply to an RPC Call message. | | | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | Controller | | | ProtonListener | | | MessageDispostionTask | | | SendTask | | | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | A ProtonListener returns this component from the | | | poll of the incoming queue. | | | | | | The message reply_to and id fields of the incoming | | | message are used to generate the target for the | | | RPC reply message. | | | | | | The RPC reply and message dispostion operations are| | | scheduled for exectuion on the Controller eventloop| | | thread. The caller on the component is blocked | | | until task completion (or timeout). | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | The ProtonIncomingMessage is used for both RPC | | | and Notification Server instances. Conceptually, | | | a Notification Server should not schedule a reply | | | and an RPC Server should not schedule a message | | | requeue. Subclassing base.IncomingMessage for | | | Notifications and base.RpcIncomingMessage for RPC | | | could be a consideration. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ ProtonListener ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *ProtonListener* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for providing the oslo.Messaging | | | base.PollStyleListener implementation. | | | | | | Provides the capabilities to manage the queue of | | | incoming messages received from the messaging links| | | | | | Returns instance of ProtonIncomingMessage to | | | to Servers | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Queue | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | An instance is created for each subscription | | | request (e.g. RPC or Notification Server). | | | | | | The Controller maintains a map of Servers indexed | | | by each specific ProtonListener identifer (target) | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ SubscribeTask ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *SubscribeTask* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for orchestrating a subscription to a | | | given target. | | | | | | Provides the capaibilitie to prepare and schedule | | | the subscription call on the Controller eventloop | | | thread. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Controller | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created for each ProtonDriver subscription | | | request (e.g. listen or listen_for_notifications). | | | | | | The task is prepared and scheduled on the caller's | | | thread. The subscribe operation is executed on the | | | Controller's eventloop thread. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ SendTask ^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *SendTask* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for sending a message to a given | | | target. | | | | | | Provides the capaibility to prepare and schedule | | | the send call on the Controller eventloop thread. | | | | | | Provides the ability be called by Controller | | | eventloop thread for the settlement of the message | | | (e.g. acknowledge or nack). | | | | | | Provides the ability to be called by Controller | | | eventloop thread upon expiry of send timeout | | | duration or general message delivery failure. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Controller | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created for each ProtonDriver "RPC Cast" or | | | "Notify" send request. | | | | | | The task is prepared and scheduled on the caller's | | | thread. The send operation is executed on the | | | Controller's eventloop thread. | | | | | | All retry, timeout and acknowledge operations are | | | performed on Controller eventloop thread and | | | indicated back to the caller thread. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ RPCCallTask ^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *RPCCallTask* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for sending an RPC Call message to a | | | given target. | | | | | | Provides all the capabilities derived from the | | | parent SendTask component. | | | | | | Provides the additional capability to prepare for | | | the RPC Call response message that will be returned| | | on the senders reply link. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Controller | | | Sender | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created for each ProtonDriver "RPC Call" | | | send request. | | | | | | The task is prepared and scheduled on the caller's | | | thread. The send operation is executed on the | | | Controller's eventloop thread. | | | | | | The Controller manages a single receiving link for | | | all RPC reply messages. Message are routed | | | using the correlation-id header in the response | | | message. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ MessageDispositionTaks ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Component | *MessageDispositionTask* | +=================+====================================================+ |Responsibilities | Responsible for updating the message disposition | | | for ProtonIncomingMessage. | | | | | | Provides the ability to acknowledge or requeue the | | | message according to application determination. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Collaborators | | | | Controller | | | ProtonIncomingMessage | | | Server | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Notes | The component is dynamically created and destroyed.| | | It is created by ProtonIncomingMessage settlement | | | calls (acknowledge or requeue) | | | | | | the task is prepared and scheduled on the caller's | | | thread. The disposition operation is a function | | | closure on the target server, receiver link and | | | delivery handle for the message received on the | | | Server receiver call back. The closure is executed | | | on the Controller's eventloop thread. | | | | | | The settlement of RPC responses is automatic and | | | not under application control. | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ |Issues | | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------+ Process View ============ The mapping of the logical operation of the driver onto the process and threading view including socket i/o will be provided in a future revision of this document. Development View ================ The decomposition of the driver code base into software code components (e.g. libraries, files, dependencies, etc.) will be provided in a future revision of this document. Physical View ============= A description of the deployment of the software system and how the driver is deployed onto the hardward infrastructure (e.g. control plane) will be provided in a future revision of this document. References ========== .. [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp10-driver-implementation .. [2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo-specs/tree/specs/juno/amqp10-driver-implementation.rst .. [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314603/ .. [4] https://github.com/kgiusti/pyngus .. [5] https://github.com/apache/qpid-proton .. [6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

commit_message:
reset cache and attribute changed by preempt case

The data generated from preempt case is maybe wrong
in rest case. So we clear the cache.
And reset attribute changed by preempt case for rest case.

Change-Id: I8908be73997d21b43b6246f1bb75ce592da75bc3
Closes-Bug: #1472948
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/62/201462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def reset_inline_edit_column(table): """Reset attribute changed by preempt case. https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1472948 """ request = table.request if request.GET.get('inline_edit_mod') != "true": return cell_name = request.GET.get('cell_name', None) if cell_name not in table.columns: return column = table.columns[cell_name] if hasattr(column, 'auto') and column.auto == "form_field": table.columns[cell_name].auto = "" # The data generated from preempt case is maybe wrong # in rest case. So we clear the cache. # https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1472948 table._populate_data_cache() self.reset_inline_edit_column(table)

commit_message:
Modification of hamburger menu CSS

On browser windows of small width, Horizon minimizes various
navigational items into two hamburger menus.  However, these menus do
not have the same styling.  This patch ensures that the CSS applied
to both menus is the same.

Closes bug: 1539961

Change-Id: I45fe5e967edcdb42bfb009c2b8f8cf2936c3b78c

commit_message:
Hide migration type from live migration modal

Admin -> Instances -> Actions -> Live Migrate Instance

Hide the migration type on the live migration modal.
Live migration action will try to do the regular live migration with shared
storage first. If it fails, will then try the live block migration.

Change-Id: I80ab7a3be8334977773e88a2045f10caad07234c
Closes-bug: #1496911

added_lines: """ Live migration action will try to do the regular live migration first. If regular migration fails and error message contains "shared storage", will try the live block migration.""" try: novaclient(request).servers.live_migrate(instance_id, host, block_migration, disk_over_commit) except Exception as e: if getattr(e, "message", None) and "shared storage" in e.message: LOG.info("Live migration failed with error: %s" " Trying live block migration now..." % e.message) novaclient(request).servers.live_migrate( instance_id, host, True, disk_over_commit) else: raise e

commit_message:
Fixing the position of tooltip on ng-create volume modal.

At the moment, the position of the tooltip of "Volume and Snapshot
Quota" in ng-create volume modal is shown on the "Volume Quota" chart.
It is incorrect so this patch fix it.

Change-Id: I5b58a463609a1f858bb97ef773589c3d03a9a06a
Closes-bug: #1561809

commit_message:
Check whether action value is string before calling format()

AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'format' will be raised
if we pass an integer value, so we should check whether the value is
a string or not.

Change-Id: I14ed4d404a9be1233493083bef49218cf0f45867
Closes-Bug: #1608393
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/92/349392/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if type(value) == str: try: act.params[formatted_param] = value.format(data=data) except KeyError as e: raise utils.Error(_('Invalid formatting variable key ' 'provided: %s') % e, node_info=node_info, data=data)
deleted_lines: try: act.params[formatted_param] = value.format(data=data) except KeyError as e: raise utils.Error(_('Invalid formatting variable key ' 'provided: %s') % e, node_info=node_info, data=data)

This removes the code that was stopping event propogation in the

commit_message:
Make angular actions dropdown menu work correctly

This fixes the angular actions menu so that it works as it's supposed
to. After selecting an item in the menu the menu will close.

This removes the code that was stopping event propogation in the
menu that I *think* was added to support the swift dashboard behavior
of selecting rows by clicking anywhere in the row. If that's the case
then it's likely that behavior could be broken by this.

Closes-Bug: #1560313
Change-Id: I46cca911f9b0d23ecede952ff45db39d4b5abd39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/54/299554/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Require auth for version api call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 13:17:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/38a950f0306881544181136090c646b047ce87e8', 'message': 'Require auth for version api call

The version call may contain information that should not be publicly
discloused without authentication. This change removes the version call
from the public urls which will cause it to require authentication
before responding with version information.
